column5: Can I ask why when doing an online shop  that when I view the different categories all sorts of random items come up!? Since when has cat food been under hair care!? Its not persuading me to buy different items  its just annoying me.  Plus  how come delivery prices have suddenly increased a lot!? The double up event has stopped  delivery prices increased  the website is all over the place & annoying & your meat has gone downhill. Maybe its time to try another supermarket :(

I think you need to have a look at the despatch emails being sent from Tesco Direct.  I ordered today and my despatch email says I can collect it......... Today!!!!! Think you have a bug in your system that needs some attention.
I could not collect my order as my daughter was off school ill.  I called and it was sent on a van.  That made my day thanks dumfries store a couple of weeks ago x

I am very unhappy with the level of customer service within your Colchester store!  I was given an  ASOS  gift card as a birthday present which was bought in your rainham store. I tried to use it on Asos and was unable to. I contacted Asos who said to return it to tesco. Your Colchester store said they couldn t look it up as wasn t bought there. I even had the receipts as proof! The only thing  Tesco  would offer me was a  goodwill  Tesco voucher!!!! All I wanted was a refund or a new Asos voucher! Why is this such a challenge!? Any help would be appreciated. Many thanks
You may wish to rebrand your  fruit & fibre  range as  fibre & find the fruit  #treasurehunt  #oneraisin 🤔

A few Saturday s ago I visited the Tesco Extra store in Failsworth with my fiancé  my 17 month old daughter and my 4 year old son who has Autism. We decided to visit the Café for some lunch and grabbed a table and I went and ordered our food.  My son has major sensory issues and because of this can get upset and scared at noises and sounds that you or I wouldn t even notice. It could be a hand dryer  a hoover  a coffee machine or something we aren t even aware of.  I could tell on our visit that his anxiety levels were rising and I put it down to the coffee machine being so loud and the fact that it was going off quite regularly. The Café was getting busy which could have also contributed to his stress levels.  My son started to get upset and stressed which meant he was becoming louder and people were starting to look over at us. A very nice member of staff named Rachael came over and informed me that I couldn t have my meal as the chef hadn t prepared any that morning. She told me that I would be refunded for this error and so I received my meal for free which I thought was great customer service.  She told me to pick anything else that I wanted from the menu. After taking my order she came back with everyone else s food and I had to wait longer for mine. This made my little boy even more anxious so I gave him my iPhone to watch in the hope that it would be a distraction for him. Normally if we are out and about and he gets upset  he will watch cartoons on my phone and be much calmer.  Today it wasn t working and his anxiety levels peaked and he went into meltdown mode. He was extremely upset and stressed out and was shouting and screaming very loudly. I noticed people looking over at us and I guess its part and parcel of having a son on the spectrum but it doesn t make it any easier.  My daughter was also becoming bored and anxious which made her cranky and upset. This makes my son even more stressed and it also made me feel pressured to calm him down. We tried everything with him: talking to him  singing to him  tickling him  distracting him  giving him the iPhone but nothing was working today. Most days  one of those distractions works but not today. I genuinely felt lost and was ready to get up and walk out without having my lunch. Then the very nice lady called Rachael walked over and approached my son. She addressed him by his name (as she had heard me talking to him) and got down to his level and placed a little booklet in front of him.   It was a free Tesco Healthy Eating booklet which were on display at the till and it had stickers inside it so you can create your own farm. She handed the booklet to my son and asked him if he would like to do some stickers. She opened the booklet and showed him the stickers and almost immediately he stopped and looked at her and said  stickers . My son doesn t use many words so this was massive for him. She spent a few minutes calmly talking to him.  I thanked her for what she had done and proceeded to help my son with the stickers where he created his own farm. He sat there for the rest of our meal  happy until we had finished.  I called Rachael over and thanked her for the way she dealt with my son. When everyone else was staring and his anxiety levels were rising  she came over and gave him 5 minutes of her time. What people don t realise is that what she did would impact the rest of our day. If he would have remained in meltdown mode then we would have had a horrendous day with him but just a little thinking outside the box and offering him her time made a huge difference and gave us a happy boy.  She told me that a friend of hers teaches children with additional needs and that she recognised what was happening with my son. I think this is absolutely fantastic and this lady changed the course of our day just by being understanding and giving him 5 minutes of her time. In a situation where I was getting stressed out and wasn t sure of what to do next  she used simplicity and diffused a challenging situation.  I would like to publicly thank Rachael for doing what she did. Not many people have an awareness or an understanding of Autism and it can be very challenging and scary for people on the spectrum and also for their families.  I would like this message to be passed on to her please so that she is aware how grateful we are and I think you should be proud of having a member of staff like Rachael in your Failsworth store. All staff should have some basic training in dealing with people with additional needs. At the end of the day its a customer facing role and your customers are all different and every store should be an inclusive store.  Thank you Rachael.
Can I buy a Gift Card in store?

8 weeks on one leg (the other broken unusable) stuck in house unable to go anywhere  only 6 weeks to go. I am in an out of the way village. Feeling fed up & bored but thankfull for online grocery shopping and home delivery. Thanks Tesco couldnt of got this far without you.

Still waiting for my shopping after booking it to arrive between 7 and 8 pm and it s now nearly 9pm. No phone calls or emails to say the delivery was going to be late. I ve had to order takeaway for tea for a family of 5 spending another £30 on top of the shopping  the takeaway has managed to arrive and be eaten but still no shopping!! I ve had to ring customer services and been kept on hold and still no explanation apart from being told it would be up to 45 mins late..now wondering if I should brave the torrential rain and walk to the shop for packed lunch stuff as possibly not going to get any shopping any time soon. Rang customer services once again and was told I would be refunded my £3 service charge from a £300 shop but they ve no idea where my shopping is!!!!!!!! Absolutely disgusting the lack of customer service I have received from tesco as a loyal customer.

Hi I ve messaged but not had a response  have purchased an Alton towers ticket with my club card vouchers to use tomorrow  have been waiting for the email ticket since 6pm can you please get back to me regarding this?
Just want to ask if you guys can show me the law ( and I mean law not policy ) that states I have to get off my bike to fill up as I can t find it online?

Just tried the Natures Store Free From Milk Chocolate Rice Cakes bought from your store in Bedford - they are completely amazing. Good amount of chocolate compared to the more well known brand in store and extremely tasty. Not sure if these are a brand that comes under the Tesco umbrella or if they are a brand that exist in their own right but I loved them - so much so I had to go back and have another one and will be purchasing the white chocolate ones next. Yum yum yum.

A big praise for the young guy(didn t get a name) from Yeovil store on the pizza counter  he was brilliant didn t have all the things I wanted for my pizza tonight  even came and found me while I was pushing my disabled mum around to tell  then he came and found me when he d made it.  Thank you
WHY HAVE YOU STOPPED SELLING VOLVIC!!!

Not impressed with my delivery today at all .  Strawberries that where on the turn .  I ordered fresh pea  in the pod .i was sent three tiny bags of peas that had started to go yellow ..  The comment from your driver was quite frankly laughable and insulting .  These are the only fresh peas we we sell peas don t come in pods.we have never sold them like that   He was recluctant  to take the   three tiny packets back
More Tesco vouchers doing the rounds  I m guessing it s another scam?
Why have you stopped doing the Size 5 Easy Fit Pants (nappies)?
I meant best before dates sorry

I have never had such a bad experience with customer service until I ve had to deal with your customer care.On Friday I availed of your offer on prosecco. I received an email stating that my order was confirmed and I would receive my delivery between 2-4 on Thursday. Today Thursday at 15.50 I received an email to say my order had been cancelled due to lack of stock. Two phone calls later to your helpline and customer services. I m still very disappointed that tesco  won t honour their side of the transaction. Tesco let me waste my day waiting  for an order that they had no intention of delivering. When I asked if tesco would honor the transaction I made with them I was told no even tho I was told my order was confirmed. Shame on you tesco. Worse customer service I have ever experienced

Tesco car insurance. What an absolute shambles! You cancel my insurance and send me a letter to advise 4 days after you d cancelled it! Then low and behold your sending my details to a debt collecting agency for a debt that I know nothing about ! No correspondence from you at all! Appalling service and and absolute scam! Diabolical! Hope this gets shared far a wide so that everyone knows what con merchants tesco car insurance is!

I have just visited your Tesco Litherland store on Hawthorne Road and was so thrilled by the act of kindness of a member of your team. I was heading back to my car with a full trolley and 10 week old son in his car seat on top of the trolley. The gentleman who was clearing the trolleys away came over to me  told me to sort my car seat out and he would load my shopping into the boot for me. He was so helpful and came out of his way to do so. I don t know his name but I see him there regularly. He had dark hair and was wearing a high vis vest over his uniform. I do hope the Manager of the store thanks him. It was lovely customer service. It can be difficult managing shopping on your own with a baby. Thanks again!
Thank you for the information you have given me  I was not aware of the projects you were helping especially locally. Thank you Tesco

Hi Tesco. My family and I have just visited your store in Leeds Roundhay and we ve made a donation of various foods to the food bank stationed outside. We just wanted to say a well done for this and say that it is a fantastic way to make make a contribution to charity. Thank you.

When your just turned 4 year old niece goes to take a mini egg out of the pick a mix and you get treated like a suspect in the great train robbery. Calm down tesco  she put the sweet back I didn t need to be stalked and watched by 3 members of staff whilst I scan our shopping.. Then approached and made to feel like she had stolen a telly.. She s a little child for gods sake.. 3 members of staff having a melt down telling us off and moaning  no one else can now buy these sweeties now ... And saying its stealing in a loud voice and talking about us.. just because she went to take one.. Bloody ridiculous and embarrassing

Do your staff receive specific training on how to kick biscuits up and down the store??? Every packet of custard creams i have bought lately have pretty much all been broken ..... how am i meant to dip them in my tea in that state?

Hi tesco. Could you please tell me when the 25% off 4 or more household items ends and also does the offer include the brand names to. I. Was in last week at bishop auckland and got tesco own make. But if it is on brand names to i will go back. I also love the tesco bio washing powder. I got plenty lol

Feeling very insulted! We did our weekly shop in Tesco today using the self scanner as usual. At the checkout we were told that a full search and check if all our shopping was required. No reason given but we had to stand in full view of the shop whilst two staff members went through all our shopping! We felt like we were being accused of shop lifting  and our previous quick checks have always been ok  so why? Robert complained to a manager afterwards and was told that was life in as many words. This is not how to treat your customers Mr Tesco ☹️
Hi. Anyone having problems with accessing Tesco? Thanks

I am done being argued with over private messenger over the service which I have received from you  Tesco. I will not be shopping with you in future  and I hasten to recommend that no one else does their online shopping with you  because if something - or a lot of things - go wrong  you deal with it appallingly. Your  customer service  representatives are an embarrassment.
Woooo hooooo little things make your day like Tesco selling Cornbread again 😘😘😘
cant log in to my grocery order

Hi - I received a F&F School Shop booklet in the post a couple of weeks ago. I would like to buy the PU Trousers for Senior Girls (Page 35 of the booklet - PU Trousers  stretch fabric  adjustable waist  black  age 11-16 £9 ) - BUT they are not showing up at all on the website - or if they are I can t seem to find them. Please can you give me a link to THOSE trousers. Thanks
Tesco.... I doubled up my club card points £10 in to £20. I ve gone to use them today but it turns out they ve expired. Is there anything I can do so I can still have my club card points. Many thanks

Tesco  you really need to do something about people parking in your parent and child spaces. I have a 6 month old and a three door car  I need the room to open my car door fully to get him out  that and somewhere to put my pushchair.   The amount of lazy people parking in the parent and child spaces when they don t have any children prevents me getting my son out the car safely and  without damaging mine or someone else s car.   I have raised this in store and they said it isn t enforced  nor is is disabled parking.   Sainsburys enforce their parking to ensure everyone who needs a space gets it.   Is there not something you can do to prevent this?
Iv dun tht survey for the 100 pound gift voucher iv completed it all and its saying tht i havnt done part 2 when i have what shall i do ?

Given The Uks recent vote to leave the eu could Tescos please highlight where your products are made especially those made in Britain so that customers can support our country and economy.   My sincre thanks

Really gets my goat when LAZY customers park in the Taxi pick up point beside the entrance - how hard is it to park in a normal parking space like everyone else and WALK. Walking is not that difficult- you put 1 foot in front of the other! Rant over!

Third week of ordering your chilli Camembert and for the third week it s been removed from my order. Not substituted just disappeared as though it was never ordered!!!still showing on my order online and as available to buy and my messages are being ignored. It may only be cheese but shows tesco s declining customer service!!🧀

I normally order polo shirts and cardigans every year from your embroidery service but this year so far there no polo shirts available for my daughters school and most of the cardigan sizes are out of stock. Is there a reason for this? School is St James s Primary Paisley. Thanks

I have been buying the Tesco free range eggs and notice it says on the box  BEST KEPT REFRIGERATED. yet they are not refrigerated at your store. Why is that? Also  why are they best kept refrigerated  I have never kepts eggs in a fridge?  Thank you.

Never am I ever shopping at Tesco again. Today I went in to do my weekly shop only to come out with a basket of food...the reason for this is because in the fruit and veg isle I could count on one hand the English produce  we are in the middle of summer yet we are importing beans from Zimbabwe  carrots from Spain  green beans from Kenya what on earth is going on....this is a British company so why can t they support and buy from our British suppliers?

Just wanted to send a MASSIVE thank you to two of your staff. This afternoon  having just picked up my car from its MOT  I popped in to Tesco in Bursledon to pick up a few bits. Unfortunately when I went to leave my battery was completely flat. I have to admit that I panicked a little! It has never happened to me before and I didn t know what to do. I had let my membership to the RAC lapse and when I called them they said they would charge me £130.00 to come and jump start my car! As a last resort I went and spoke to TINA at customer services. I explained the situation  fully expecting that they wouldn t be able to help me. Little did I know that you employ such wonderful people!! After trying and failing to call someone  TINA went on a mission to see if there was anyone who could help. She returned with SIMON from dot.com (I think). He had jump leads in his car so was going to jump start me. I seriously wanted to kiss him!!! I was parked in a bit of a tricky spot so he decided to try to push me to a hill and try and bump start it. With the help of a kind man in the car park he succeeded!! So thank you  thank you  thank you to TINA and SIMON. There are some good people out there and today I met two of them. Hopefully this will make its way to them so they can see how much I appreciate what they did for me.

Hi  I ordered some tickets for a day out at Thorpe Park on the Clubcard site  I have an email confirming the other from Tesco... but nothing from anyone else.. Do you know how I go about finding out how to get the tickets please?

Visited Mereside Tesco in Blackpool today  I found the security team intimidating following us around up and down the aisles pretty annoying.  First time we have been here and we won t be coming back..  Security guard seemed really pleased with himself when the dreaded alarm went off as we were leaving shame we soon wiped the smile off his face when we produced our receipt and he was like ohh.. Disgraceful!!

Just had my tesco delivery and Rudy and James who were the delivery drivers from the Hemel Hempstead store just went over and above their job role. I forgot to add milk to my shopping list and within 5 minutes I had a knock at the door and they had returned back to my house with 2 pint milk for me that they had grabbed from the shop around the corner. It was so thoughtful of them and very unexpected. Put a smile on my face and they deserve to recognised for this ☺️

I ve just got to look for clothing/shoes online after seeing some bits in store but not in the right sizes. This was my first time using it since it moved to tesco direct and I have to say I found it awful. So hard just to browse I gave up in the end!

Tesco you seem to be very proud of lots of things judging by your posts; are you proud of the incredibly poor way that you are treating your night colleagues in stores no longer doing night replen? Full time colleagues offered a max of 22 hour or redundancy  no early release on redundancy for those who find another job  only 45 days notice from start to end of process for your loyal staff!!!  I for one will be cancelling every single one of my tesco products including credit card  ISA  Clubcard and will never shop.in a tesco store again.

Hello I m hoping you can help I ordered some lovely dresses from yourselves for my annual summer dance show  unfortunately I am one short and they have gone off your website - is there any way that I could track one down in store? Hope you can help :-)
Just ate your Tuscan bean soup and it was really nice. I ll be buying more of this soon. X

Shared on behalf of my mum Gail Prestwood Davenport. We thank you Claire and all others who helped x   I want to thank the staff at Tesco Rochdale for how they cared and helped my lovely neighbour this afternoon after some low life scumbag stole her handbag. She had withdrawn money at the cash point outside the store  something she never normally does and whilst shopping in the store her bag was stolen. She is a petite lady in her early 70 s who would do anything for anyone.  The Manager who my neighbour said is called Claire Gaffrey went above and beyond  she obtained all the numbers my neighbour needed to cancel her cards and block her phone straight away  something that my neighbour tells me she would have struggled with  and put my neighbours shopping through the checkout at no charge to make sure she had  the shopping she needed.  My neighbour has been badly shaken up but keeps saying how lovely the Tesco staff were with her  so thank you again Tesco especially Manager Claire    Michelle Giles do you know her??

I wasn t impressed with the dot com van driver who decided to cut across a T-junction right in front of me in a little village called gamlingay this afternoon around 5pm if I was there any sooner he could of hit my car
Hello  Just wanted to ask you when will be Go Pro Hero4 Silver edition in stock on tesco direct please? Would like to buy one 😊😊 Thank you
Disappointing customer service from Tesco Photo Books....
Hi been trying to do your promotion for an hour and it said I had won the £100 gift card but it won t let me complete it I followed all the instructions I m really annoyed!!

Absolutely fed up of having to throw tescos 4 pint milk away as it goes off 4-5 days before its use by date - todays 4 pints valid until july 3rd - totally sour & curdled - going to stop shopping as cannot afford this wastage every week
I have noticed that a lot of your products use chicken from Thailand?!  Is there a reason for this?

So... We ordered and received 2 10x8 metal sheds from Tesco Won t say it was a smooth transaction as the roofs never arrived and then did seoerately But we got them! On the 8th June we then decided we d order another 8x6  Chased it up today only to be told because you re on the Isle of Wight the supplier won t come So not only have we wasted 20 days  were without the shed!!!!! The 3 sheds some to just over £1000  They could have said there s a surcharge towards it Staggered that a company the size of Tesco accepts this from their suppliers Glad to know they re obviously busy enough to turn away orders and satisfy a customer! Thanks Tesco!!!!

dont order online with tesco.    i have ordered some electronics for instore collection which have been stolen by someonme in wareshouse.  customer services refusing to refund or replace until they have investiagted  It looks like the warehouse guys not the only thieves #useless #thievingbastards

Please can you advise when your whole school uniform will be available online? At the moment only 8 items come up. Not my boys school colours tho. Asda has a huge range currently available but I prefer to shop at tesco.

Just popped into the tesco extra Clifton store in Blackpool and cannot thank them enough  especially fernando for their help. Oliver my little 2 year old had cut his head on the car door as we were about to enter the store  I went and asked for a first aider to give it a wipe to see how bad the cut was and all the staff I came across from security to the customer service desk  the lovely lady who applied first aid  the duty manager and of course fernando who made Oliver smile with a juice and magazine were totally amazing and super helpful. You guys just made a horrible situation for me a lot easier and made my little boy feel a lot better. Luckily it was only a small cut but the staff at this tesco store made a big difference! Thank you! :-) these guys deserve a big pat on the back! X
Have you stopped doing TeX mex dips  I m ordering online and can t find them

Paying extra for named day delivery  choosing a day the Tesco offers  staying in all day and not getting the delivery!!!!!! Bad bad bad! Not to mention misleading and annoying!!!  Oh and....FYI.....Aberdeen is not on the Highlands and Islands....we are on the Scottish mainland in Grampian!!!

My grandaughters 2nd birthday has been ruined by tesco not delivering the little tikes house ordered from them Between them and little tikes they failed to supply firstly as ordered in 7 days then tesco couldn t find the address and returned it  then promised it again for Monday 2 days after her birthday when again it didn t arrive after more phone calls were told it was damaged and another would have to be ordered another 10 days shame on you avoid if you don t want disappointment
Can u tell me wen school uniforms are going to b fully stocked online n in-store. As want to get prepared for September.

Well done Tesco for finally seeing sense regarding the pedestrian access to the Burnham-on-Crouch Tesco Express!  Right since the store was first opened I have written to you many times  and commented here and in my surveys that a foot access on the north side would make much more sense; the way you constructed it  every single foot customer had to walk across your car park  sometimes negotiating with your delivery lorries too.  Thank goodness that as from now all customers coming from the north will not have to walk in your car park at all; and customers coming from the south now have the choice whether to take a chance crossing your car park and delivery bays or whether to walk a few paces further north and walk in complete safety around the newly constructed  pavement .     Out of interest  I wonder if you would consider letting us know how many accidents to people on foot have been reported in your car park (though I appreciate that some would be drivers and passengers getting to/from their cars).  I also appreciate that not all incidents would have been reported  not to mention  near misses ...... big big thanks for making your premises that much safer!

I would like to thank the lovely lady at Tesco Chineham behind customer services today. My 2 year old some fell over on the way from the carpark to the store and cut his lip with his teeth bleeding quite badly. I asked her if she had some tissue she asked what had happened if we were okay and she offered me first aid( which I declined ) and got him a ice lolly to help with the swelling. It was a lovely thing to do even if he didn t want it. What lovely caring service !! I m sorry I didn t get her name but THANK YOU x

Very very disappointed in my Finest flowers bought for my 70th birthday yesterday. Bought on Thursday in St Austell and came down yesterday to find one chrysanthemum completely in bits all over the table and floor. Sad isn t it and a yellow lily has just been thrown out today today

Ordered my RAC Membership renewal through Clubcard Boost several days ago  but still no email voucher received and no other contact. I see there is a note to say that you are aware of a problem with delivering email vouchers  on the Clubcard website  but is there any update on how long this will take to rectify please? My membership is soon to expire and this is not great customer service.

Tesco customer service used to be so good but it has clearly gone downhill. On June 26th I ordered a clubCard boost  which usually is delivered very promptly. However this time it took 36 hours for the email to reach me which meant the boost promotion had run out. When I email customer services  they refunded the clubCard point but told me it was my own fault for leaving the purchase until the last minute. Yes I was last minute but I was still within the time frame detailed in the terms and conditions so I should have been able to use the vouchers. The new pairs of glasses I was going to put the vouchers towards are still sitting in the basket and I am thinking of going elsewhere for specs. Being told it is my own fault does not make for good customer services.

Hi Tesco....   I m not normally one to complain.... But on 2 separate occassions i have brought your own brand nappies comfort dry ones in size 5+ for my daughter....   Before you changed the design with the  expandable sides (which i think is good)   My daughters nappies have exploded out of the side of them with the gel crystals...  Doesnt matter how many times i change her bottom... She has only got to have 1 wee in them and it does this.   I use to buy your nappies always but i have lost trust in your brand.   I have spoken to a few of my mummy friends who have had the same problem as this.   I have now decided to move to another supermarket brand

Hi tesco...its coming to the end of another school year  so i decided to start pricing up new uniforms for september....but WOW....there is like nothing on the F&F page  is it all still being moved over? and do you know when it will be working properly as I like to buy before the rush starts (esp cos my son is in sizes which seem to sell out quick) if not I will have to go to asda which isnt as convenient for us at all.
WHY is it that Tesco do not seem to stock ANY Organic fresh juices ?

I just had my first ever grocery delivery from you as I have broken my leg and am stuck (temporarily) in a wheelchair. I was little more excited at the prospect of my delivery due to this fact  as I am sure you can imagine.  I have 2 things to report to you. 1. The delivery driver was marvellous  happy  friendly and extremely helpful. Something which has brightened my day. Been stuck in the house since Sunday so was nice to see a smiling face. My order number is 220388216  if this helps you to get a message back to him!  2. Unfortunately not great news for number 2. After the joy of my delivery it appeared to be snack time for my little (nearly) one year old girl  Arienne. Imagine my dismay when her favourite kingsmill pancakes were not there? Thankfully her being only 1 years old she seemed happy enough with a hot buttered crumpet so all was not lost (currently on offer 2 for £1.20 may I add for the readers benefit). Anyway  I m not after a refund as its only a couple of pence but thought I d bring it to your attention. Had it been my nappies it could have been a different story. No nappies for arienne would have been a disaster of first world proportions  can you imagine?  Anyway  please try and pass my thanks on to Mr delivery man and tell if he comes across the pancakes  he s welcome!  Regards  Kylie
Has anyone else found Tesco s terms and conditions very vague?

Waited up until past midnight for a  10-11pm  delivery that never materialised... customer service closed at 11pm... no-one bothered telling me that it wasn t actually coming at all... 16 hours without food as a result. That s one way to diet  I guess!  It s ok though  even though I had to go shopping somewhere else first thing this morning (at my own additional expense) to be able to eat at all today  which utterly defeats the point of  home delivery  if nothing else  and have had to work from home today to collect my £100 worth of groceries lest another delivery fails  I guess I did get offered a £10  good will  voucher and £1 delivery charge refund.   Absolutely unbelievable - it cost me more that in time wasted alone.   Obviously one customer moving to Ocado here as a direct result of this insult over injury  but I just wanted to let people know that it s pretty pointless relying on you lot. Even the  delivery manager (?) managed to ring me later than promised!  -  Valued customer   lol.

Your app deleted half of my shopping! Was supposed to cost nearly £90 and when it came only £70 of it was on the receipt. No meat - I ordered a full chicken  bacon  mince etc - all gone off the list. Some veg too including celery. Any idea why!? I have to go out now to top up  and I paid the delivery fee to get everything i put in my basket not just some of it  😡

I entered your Trowbridge store this morning as do most mornings (and have done for years) to grab my lunch for work. I fancied something different today  I knew what I wanted but couldn t seem to locate it so thought I would ask one of your (usually) helpful and friendly staff...  Firstly  with this day and age of self scanning handsets I would NEVER assume that because someone was holding a hand scanner that they worked in the store.   Secondly I wouldn t assume that someone wearing a navy blue jumper worked in store either. (Unless Tesco have a trademark on that exact pigment that I was unaware of) especially as they don t say  Tesco  on the back.  So back to the story... I see this older lady wearing a navy jumper while scanning products and I wasn t entirely sure if she worked in the store. After a few failed attempts to check if she had a name badge or anything on her that may indicated she was in fact an employee  I thought I d just ask.   excuse me  do you work here  I said  with the friendliest consumer smile on my face I could manage at 9am.  She responded by holding the scanner up to my face and saying  WELL DUH?   Never been made to feel uncomfortable by a member of your staff before  but I think this encounter will stick with me for a while.  Manners... every little helps.

This is a warning to all those who live in a digital world. I just called in to my local Sainsburys because it s walking distance away. I just wanted a few emergency items as I didn t have time to go to my favourite tesco store.  I can t believe it but they actually refused to serve me because I wanted to use my nectar app instead of a plastic thing. What a gall! I have never had any problems in any Tesco or any other store that has a points card.  I have learned my lesson and will never spend one more pence in any Sainsburys stores.

Dear Sir / Madam I have used Tesco direct many times  and even the Tesco outlet on eBay  I have no complaints about your products or customer service  but it would be a so much better shopping experience if you and your partners used a different courier company  I was expecting a delivery of a rowing machine yesterday  to be delivered by DPD parcel delivery service  at just before 10 am having taken a day off work to be in for the delivery I d paid £8 odd for  I received a message telling me that actually the parcel in question hadn t arrived at thier depot in the first place !?!?  This from the people who the last time I had the misfortune to be expecting a delivery from them  eventually after I phoned them at gone 5pm  admitted they had forgot to put it on the van that morning !  Today  despite downloading thier app to my smartphone  and clicking on the box saying please only deliver between 9 am and 2.30 pm  at quarter to nine it said thier driver was 15 mins away  at 5 to nine he d been and gone and I d missed my parcel.  Now the only way I can get my parcel is to have it delivered to a shop  2 miles away  where even though I have a disability and have to take regular prescribed pain relief medication for a severe back injury  I have to go to and collect the heavy parcel myself  and then once I get it home carry it up 2 flights of stairs to my flat  and this is the service I paid so much for !!  Maybe in future you could give customers the option to arrange thier own delivery service  as I regularly use HERMES parcel delivery service  who are hands down a far better company. Yours sincerely  Miss Jessica Berry ( a customer about to be in agony ! )
Will never use your online grocery service again!!!charged for an order you had picked and packed and then decided to cancel!!!!I wasn t even given a call to explain this!!!disgusting behaviour !!!!

Dear Tesco   Congratulations I think you have managed to surpass yourselves at breaking the trades descriptions act....tonight we had quiche at least I think it was quiche as it said so on the box  broccoli and tomato  what came out my oven looked like a quiche  but sadly it ended there.  What I did get however  was tiny lumps of broccoli poking their heads up from what resembled a dry African river bed complete with cracks and in addition to that I was unable to find a piece of tomato anywhere....what I did find was a slathering of sweet sickly tomato puree under the cracked riverbed holding the darned thing together!!  My daughter had a different flavour  she had quiche Lorraine....oooh yummy I hear you say....not I think  again a dry river bed but this time it had pieces of what can only be described as a worn out girly pink trampoline cut into squares masquerading as ham...  If you insist on making food that defies description please do include a free stomach pump with every purchase   Yours sincerely   Hungry

When I visited the Argos in Barnstaple (rose lane) today I must say I was very shocked by Tesco s staffs attitude and choices in how to tell potential shoppers the store was closed. Whilst at the same time part of the link road was shut. Already causing tail backs at the main roundabout. Tesco staff continued to stop traffic by the garage to tell each individual car the store was closed. Causing more tail backs onto the main road. Very frustrating as not all cars are visiting Tesco. Alot were actually going to Argos or Wickes. When we advised of the issues with the traffic the Tesco staff were very rude and ignorant. They seemed under the impression they were doing some sort of traffic job when in fact a simple sign saying Tesco Closed would have been sufficient. Or even stopping cars as they enter the Tesco carpark. It would have also saved us the 15 min waiting time. Thanks Tesco!

Can you help?  I am running 100km in August to raise money for a local hospice that provides care for terminally ill children. I teach and students at the school would like to set up a refreshments stall to sell snacks and drinks to raise money. Are you able to donate such items for their stall?

This afternoon I was shopping in your Plymouth Roborough store when my 10 year old son had a bad nose bleed. We were at the self scan checkouts so I was very aware of holding up the queue and I couldn t abandon my shopping and go to the toilets to tend to him.  A First Aider was called and David  a gentleman we usually see on the security desk came to our rescue.  To say he is a credit to you Tesco is an understatement  this man was beyond kind to my son.  Josh can become a little worried when he suffers a nose bleed and David kindly took him to one side and sat him down whilst I quickly scanned the last bits of my shopping. He sat with him for over 15 minutes until his nose had stopped bleeding  and then proceeded to clean him up from head to toe despite me offering to do it he told me that was no problem at all. David joked with Josh throughout the exchange  making light of what was a worrying situation for Josh. When Josh failed to understand some of his banter and I felt I needed to explain that Josh is autistic  David explained to Josh in a way he could understand. If you could pass on my thanks once again  and to say that Josh spoke about his kindness all the way home and will remember that act for a long time coming.

Just wanted to say today I came to your Wragby Road store in Lincoln  I was delighted to see your free from range. My son has a milk allergy and we ve always struggled to cater for him with certain foods and we ve never found such a wide selection of milk free items. I will make sure we use you for our weekly shop from now on.

Tesco   Tonight I stopped into your Stalybridge store to get my children a drink etc in your cafe before their dance class. I needed to use the facilities however  not for the first time  found the disabled toilet to be out of order. Now  this is not just an  inconvinience  as suggested on the notice on the door but a serious problem! I have various mobility problems  trouble with my grip (ie I cannot pull open heavy fire doors) and I need grab rails so the usual ladies facilities are just not suitable. Are your disabled customers of that little importance that you cannot have one functioning disabled toilet in your entire store on multiple occassions? I will be having to find somewhere else to take my children for a drink and snack before their dance class in future if I cannot have assurances that this will not keep happening.

I had some very good customer service in your highwoods store in colchester today. The fruit and veg manager and a young lady called Emily from the chilled section. I requested to speak to a manager about some dried up spilled yogurt that was on the shelf in the fridge. My reason for wanting a manager was that I had previously mentioned this yogurt twice  once on Sunday and once LAST Tuesday. As luck would have it the lady I spoke to last Tuesday was the Fruit and veg manager from today. She quite rightly was disgusted that a week later I had to complain again. She offered me some free yogurts and was very apologetic (even though it wasn t her section). And Emily although not her mess was happy to clean the shelf there and then  both members of staff were friendly  helpful and willing to go out of their way to put it right. I didn t get the managers name  but I would like to thank her again. And I hope the manager responsible for the free from yogurt section and their staff thank her too.

Sadly an elderly lady was killed yesterday - run over by a Tesco lorry leaving the Tesco Express Store in Jersey Farm  St Albans.  This tragic accident would not have happened if you had listened and addressed the continual complaints from local residents about the size of lorries delivering to this store. Furthermore had the delivery bay of your shop been cleared of rubbish instead of resembling the local rubbish tip the lorry in question would have been able to reverse properly into the delivery bay - instead the lorry over hung the pavement forcing pedestrians into the road. This elderly lady was forced into the road to continue her journey and was not seen by the driver as he left the store. Tesco your arrogance and disregard of the immediate neighbourhood is beyond belief.  You have done absolutely nothing to address these issues which have been highlighted to you time and time again  but you choose to operate completely as you choose. Yesterday you made the grand gesture of closing the store  but today you opened as normal - very sadly a lady s life was lost yesterday because of your refusal to deal with the on going problem of deliveries to this store. Just what does have to happen to make you listen.

I took my 4 year old grandson to Tesco Extra Seacroft cafe as a treat yesterday and i am totally disgusted at the food that was served. i ordered sausages  mash and peas for my grandson  all that he was able to eat were the sausages  and they looked like thay had been kept warm for some time  the gravy was full of congealed lumps and the instant mash was dried up.  i ordered flat bread with cheese ham and mushrooms   it was cold and was more like a pizza with a thick stodgy base  (there was tomato paste on the base which was not mentioned ) I don t eat tomato.I was unable to complain as my grandson was starting to get irritable as he was hungry so i had to go elsewhere to eat.  I think Tesco need to check their description of food on the menu and also check how long the food has been sitting before dishing it up to their customers.  i certainly won t be eating there again.

To Tesco in Harpenden. Just want to say a massive thank you to 2 of the friendly men and the lovely lady who was working today. You did more than i could ever ask for. After getting stuck in a lot of traffic up at Luton Airport and running very low on fuel I couldn t find any other petrol station. I actually ran out of petrol just before the pump on the forecourt (partially blocking the entrance). I firstly asked a stranger if he could help me and hes response was if you cant find anyone else then i will have to but i am running late. The next man i asked just point blankly refused. Now feeling very emotional and angry and upset i went in and just stood in front of the tills where the lady serving (sorry didn t catch her name) asked if i was OK. i explained what happened and i was trying so hard not to cry :( she immediately buzzed for a colleague who got another gentleman and they came to my rescue without hesitation. I am so glad they were there because my car is to heavy for someone like me to push.  I am so grateful for these 3 members of staff that i wish i could do something to show my appreciation.  Thank again Tesco Harpenden  Love Hayley Theed (the lady in the stranded car)

I purchased some tesco Direct items online for collection at Goole today after 3pm. Thank you again you have some wonderful staff on your team.

Just had THE most amazing customer service at Tesco near Warfield  Bracknell.  I lost my bank card in store between paying for my shopping  writing in a couple of birthday cards and going to the kiosk for stamps.   Amanda at customer services looked all around the checkouts etc where I d been whilst I was searching through my purse    put my shopping to one side whilst I went to retrace my steps  offered to get me some new replacement frozen food when it took a while to finally give up looking  Gave my 2 year old daughter a fake flower (left over from an event) to keep her occupied whilst I was looking.  Taped up the envelopes of the birthday cards i d opened to check It hadn t accidentally fallen inside   And gave me two stamps to post the cards (to my two 6 year old god children whose birthday it is tomorrow).  She was so helpful and friendly throughout  I was clearly stressed and my tired two year old was being a handful!  She took my details and phoned me when someone handed it in about 30 mins later!  She was fantastic! Went over and above my expectations and she deserves a real pat on the back for her commitment to the customer!!  Thanks Amanda and Tesco xx

Would like to warn everyone about the importance of remembering to lift your card from tesco!! My partner and I were in tesco Carrickfergus on Friday night.. We bought what we needed and inserted the card into self check out and left. We did not realise that we had either left the bank card in the machine or dropped it putting it away. We noticed on Saturday that the card was missing and remembering that tesco was the last plus that we had used it  went down to check.  We went down and the girl at the check out at customer service confirmed that the card had been handed in after checking ID .. However due to in incident happen else where in the building no one could access the card for us at that time. She said we could either wait or come down the next day assuring is it would be safe as it was locked away.  However when we went down this morning to collect the card that was not the case. Tesco lost the card!! All the paper trail was there saying it should be there; all details of the card wrote down so clearly the card has been there however in the bag in which the card should have been held in there was no card! Sounds funny right  it s a good thing we noticed when we did. Right now anyone could have that card so we have had to cancel the card because tesco have lost it after claiming that it would be perfectly safe locked away!  Appalling behaviour and does not reflect good on them whatsoever!  Please check that you have your card before leaving!

We have regularly used your home delivery service for years now  without any issues. Until this week that is. We were informed on the morning of our due delivery date that our order had been cancelled due to the money not being in the bank. So we checked our online banking to discover that £120.00 has been removed from our account  as it has gone to yourselves. Our first issue with this is that our shopping bill was just under £75.00. So the amount didn t even make sense. So my wife called customer services and spoke to a lady who basically said that it would be sorted by the next day. This would of been regrettable  but understandable.  (remember. Two small children.) The next day comes and no money in our bank  and no call from yourselves. So my wife speaks to the bank and you have our money  one of your customer service team confirms you have our money  but the lady dealing with this days that you havn t. They then inform my wife that the problem will be resolved Monday. We now have no shopping  no money and two children to feed. We have had to beg for money off friends and family  something I feel shamed to have had to do  just so our children can eat. But it s ok because you advised us that we would be  compensated . Probably in the form of online coupons to spend within your company. So yes happy times.

Can I please say a HUGE thank you to your staff at your Bishop Auckland store.   I placed a online order a couple of weeks ago as I couldn t get out as my little boy was really poorly with Scarlett fever.   I placed the order for delivery the following day but realised that I needed the shopping sooner than expected as I was running out of cold things for him rapidly  he had a very very high temperature and I was doing all I could to get it down. I telephoned and asked if there was any chance I could get it on the very first slot the following day and explained the situation. The staff very kindly moved my delivery slot forward to the same day so that he had his ice lollies and stuff for his temp and delivered it promptly  within 2 hours! The delivery manager ever called me the following day to see how my little boy was and to see if I needed anything else.  So a huge huge thank you to your wonderful staff.  I literally had no one to get to the shop for me and you were all amazing- Thank you! Xx

So id just like to share a little story of our latest visit to tesco. A couple of days ago i visited a store with a view to buying a new tv. The first 2 stores were out of stock. At the 3rd store  they had the tv i wanted. Hooray! I took the ticket to the desk and the member of staff went out back to get it for us. 15 minuets later he came back out and said he couldnt find any but would speak to his manager about a discount on the display tv. We agreed  but as only 1 of the 15 or so tvs had a programme playing  i asked if the feed could be switched to the tv i wanted so i could check for any damage or dead pixels. This is where it went even more down hill. The guy serving us didnt know how to do it. And apparently neither did the other 6 members of the electrical department. Thats right.... 7 members of staff trying to get a picture up on the tv. After about 30 mins  my girlfriend suggested to them that they take the hdmi lead out of the working tv and plug that in. After another 10 mins and 4 staff not being able to do this  one of them comes out with a usb stick with a demo vid on it. He finally plugged it in  to find there were no files on it. Anyway  it was getting late so i gave in and just said id take the risk. 3 guys removed the tv from the wall  and one went to get a screwdriver to take the wall bracket off. 10 mins later he still hasnt come back  so i used my multitool and did it myself. Then they couldnt get it back in the box  so again i did it myself with them watching. I asked them if everything was there and they did check and assured me it was complete. Remote  yes. Stand  yes. Manuals  yes. Power cord  yes. Great. Lets go pay. The cashier then couldnt work out the 10% discount  so again  i told him what it was and the final cost. Took him a while to figure out how to use the till to put the new rate in  but he finally got there and i paid. Another nice man gave me a hand to take it to the car  as the girlfriend had got bored and did some shopping so had quite a few bags with her.  At 9pm  2 hours  yes  thats 2 hours after arriving at the store  we finally left with the tv. Got home went to plug it all in and guess what. The part of the tv stand that goes between the tv and the base of the stand was missing. Great. Called the store and after looking they said it wasnt there. So the discount i had for buying a used tv   was spent buying the adaptor for the stand. I shound have just gone to curry s and bought a brand new one from there! Hello Tesco   I was wondering if you count answer some questions for me relating to the way you package your food.   I have recently been on holiday to Norway and was pleased to see much food packaged in paper and card as oppose to plastic.  As I am sure you are aware a large amount of plastic enters the marine environment and has devestating and long lasting effects on marine life. Even a large portion of plastic that is recycle able  such as plastic bottles and pots  cannot be turned back in to the original product  therefore technically we do not recycle it but  down cycle  it. It inevitably end up in landfill where it can take hundreds of years to break down.  As I saw in other shops  products including pasta  cous cous  nuts  seeds  rice and many more came in resealable cardboard cartons. Bread came in paper bags  not plastic bags.  Paper and card are 100% recycle able  biodegradable and renewable  making them a cleaner greener choice.  Is it possible for you to switch to more sustainable packaging?  I hope you can spare the time to read this thoroughly and I look forward to your response. Thanks  John

Ppl just be careful I used a self scan till this morning at the Chester store used chip and pin machine said it hadn t gone through but it had was told to use the next machine and paid cash so I ve been charged twice

Very disappointing service in your Banchory store. A staff member told me around three weeks ago he would do a store order for  6 cushions I wanted which were not in stock. I never heard from the store  went in twice to check on this - was told once they d let me know when they came in  second time NOBODY could be found to help me  according to Customer Service staff.   When I still heard nothing I went ahead and ordered them from Tesco Direct for pick up from this Banchory store. I received the message yesterday that the 6 cushions were ready to collect. I went in to the Banchory store this morning and after a long wait for assistance only two cushions could be found. It honestly seemed at that point that it would be left at that  but I had paid for 6  and so I persisted in trying to find out what to do then. I was told three different things -  only part order had come and they d follow    they may have been lost    they would have to re-order the 4 others   but nobody could confidently assure me there wouldn t be an issue if I signed for the part order.  Throughout all this everyone was adamant they were definitely not in the store. After 4 members of staff were involved  and a second check of the bonded warehouse was made at my urging - the other 4 were found.  Somebody had put them in the returns area  was the explanation apparently. Had I not stood my ground I may never have seen them  as it was agreed these might have been returned with having been put in the returns area.   Very unimpressed indeed  especially as the store is almost 12 miles away from my house and I had gone especially to get them today. I have made 4 trips to the store regarding these cushions  and that has cost me fuel and precious time. I was there almost 25 minutes this morning. This is NOT the service you advertise -  More Choice  Made Easy .  I hope this very unsatisfactory customer experience will be taken on board in an effort to prevent other customers experiencing the same poor service.

Absolutely disgusted with Tesco.  Bought a Hudl2 last year that the screen cracked on whilst on charge after 11 months. As I had taken the optional insurance  I was advised to speak to them. They arranged a repair and the Hudl was returned  fitted with a USED screen. I rang to complain  but was told it was policy...  Lo and behold  a couple of weeks later the same thing happened. I rang to speak to them  to be told that they had  paid out the maximum under the policy  really? For a faulty used screen?  Wrote to Tesco as advised they couldn t take a complaint either over the phone out via email  which is surprising as we live in the 21st century.   Anyway  they emailed back saying they aren t interested and passing the buck to Square Trade  the warranty company.   Looking online there are numerous instances of this happening  and I am disgusted that not only did it happen  but that they used a screen taken from a 2nd hand item that is known to suffer with this fault. The fact that they obviously don t warrant a repair for any length of time is also not good. As far as I m concerned the Hudl2 is nether for purpose  not of merchantable quality. I now have an extremely unhappy 4 yr old son who doesn t understand why his tablet has broken TWICE.   I d advise anyone to avoid purchasing electronic items from Tesco as their attitude to problems is woeful.

I wish to complaint about my treatment at my local tesco Broadstairs extra store this morning! I always use the self scan tills. This morning I purchased some alcohol and the till flashed up I needed to be id d to check I was over 25! Without a care in the world the young man was straight over and without even a glance at me pushed the   definitely no shadow of a doubt is she well over 25 button  and zoomed off to assist someone else!  Now I know I shop in your store enough to probably pay everyone s wages and their pensions and therefore the self service staff know me! and I know the staff are always friendly  courteous  efficient and professional but he could have as least have pretended to have appraised my age!  Signed  feeling middle aged of Broadstairs.

Just wanted to tell you about one of your lovely staff members credit where it s due.. My 2 year old is potty training this week that morning he had an accident just as I saw your driver pull up and I had just started giving my newborn his bottle so I quickly sorted my toddler and answered the door whilst feeding baby n he immediately said oh is it breakfast time shall I bring this through for you he walked past the mess in the living room and wasn t fussed over all the potty stuff he went to get more trays and I put the bottle down to start unloading the shopping with my 2 year old who loves that job when he came back with more trays he picked the bottle up passed it to me and started unloading everything with my boy helping him lift the heavy items on t the side .. Little things but it was just one of the moments where u think oh no typical everything happens at once and it s so much easier when you have a friendly helpful person to get even the smallest of things done for you thank you so much :)

I m disgusted with the treatment of my sister in law at the scan as you shop checkouts today. She is registered blind  having enough difficultly already needing to be guided and helped to shop...when we reached the till I was assisting her to pay for her goods  her card is chip and signature  the woman on the tills refused to allow her purchases  as the back of her card was not signed. I explained her predicament and the fact that she had just got married so the other cards were in a different name. By this time my SIL was already reduced to tears at the checkout  we were asked to go and withdraw cash to pay but this was also unfeasible as her cards do not have a PIN number. I asked for a manager who also said as tescos policy they wouldn t allow her to buy her shopping. Fortunately I was with her so I payed for the shopping myself. But I feel tescos handled this situation wrongly and by such discriminated against a disabled person! Makes me think twice about continuing to shop there!!!

Something has been on my mind all day regarding the referendum so I m gonna vent to the amazing world of Facebook.  When in Tesco on my way to work today  the cashier asked me if I had voted  to which I replied yes. She then asked me how I voted  to which I told her. I didn t think this would be a massive issue - we all have our own opinions and that s ok  it s the way of the world and we can t all agree 100% of the time can we?!   I was very shocked by this cashiers response which was along the lines of  Oh my god  why did you vote that way? Should ve voted this way!   Please tell me lovely Susan (this wasn t actually her name but I don t know her name so she s now called Susan!) why shouldn t I have voted the way I did? Because it s the wrong way according to you? Because it s not the same as the way you voted? I m intrigued as to why it infuriates you so much that I have my own mind and today I actively used it by voting for what I believe should happen?!   As you can see I have left out specifics regarding whether I voted in or out. This being because it s no ones business except mine  I am not going to judge anyone on the way they ve voted today  or their reasons behind it. We are all DIFFERENT and INDIVIDUAL and that is what make us  us.  Rule of thumb for me from now on will be that I will NOT discuss my voting decisions; not to friends  family or strangers.  So thanks  Susan  from Carmarthen Tesco for teaching me to keep my mouth shut from now on  because sadly the world will always judge or have something to say about your views and opinions.   Over and out! ✌🏽️

Good evening Tesco   Nearly two weeks ago my partner ordered us a new garden furniture set. We were not in a rush to have it delivered and selected Saturday the 25th of June as a delivery day as a Saturday is the only day where one of us is guaranteed to be home.  On Wednesday last week (22nd June) my partner received a call from Arrow XL (the courier) to say that they were at our house. They were rather rude about the fact that we weren t in and had to take our furniture back to the depot. They claim they don t deliver on a Saturday so why were we able to select this option?  Since then we have been plagued by phone calls from extremely rude staff in this useless company  the latest of which informed me that I had to pick one of two days next week for the delivery to take place. I told them that after 1pm on friday would be the only time that would suit us and I was told in a rather sharp reply that they cannot guarantee a time.  I would ask that you as a company take heed of this and of the terrible reviews Arrow XL receive on a daily basis and stop using them as a courier.  Cheers.

Good Morning Tesco  I have taken time to decide weather or not to write this here  I slept on something my 8yr old said last night  I have decided to pop you a message. Last Friday my husband was doing the usual Friday afterschool shopping trip with or son (14  profound autism) he loves to shop  he waits all week to do it - it is actually used to help him manage his time and  wait for things  helping him also to manage behaviours and anxiety associated with wanting to buy things constantly. Accompanying him on this trip was his 8yr old brother. The trip started generally uneventfully apart from the couple who found looking at our son constantly an art in iteself  think it distracted them from thier shopping (i digress.... we as parents have travelled this road of educating the general public in autism awareness many times! ) The stinger on this trip was the securtiy guard  he was actually like some kind of shadow  he followed my hubby  my 14yr old (who is quite a vocal child with autism  lots of noises  hand flapping and pacing around shouting random words out for all to hear!) Tesco  this went on for the whole shopping trip  to the point that my husband asked him if there was an issue.The secuity guard was even waiting at the end of the checkout. Please note that our 14yr old needs 1-1 as he has no sense of danger so getting side tracked as a parent can be a problem! Lets not forget 8yr old brother who just coasts along on these trips and just  takes it on the chin  what random events occur when you have a brother with autism. My point here  I know i am rambling somewhat  the point I slept on last night was  we went back to store yesterday  me & my 8rd old. Do you know what he said!?  I hope the secutiry guard doesnt follow us mummy  he shouldnt though because we dont have my brother with us  Now Tesco  come on  this isnt the type of thing an 8yr old should be thinking! He has enough to deal with from the general public and their lack of awareness  I hope we have bought our children up to be kind  and compassionate little people who take in to account differences. Autism awareness  would the store like some tips? We have shopped in this store since our son with autism was a small boy  he has learnt to wait  be patient (doesnt always work) and to understand he cant always get what he wants  there have been times he has layed on the floor and flatly refused to move but generally staff  get it . I will point out here Mr Tesco that head office are aware of this event and they have asked the store to contact us  twice! it has been escalated but head office. They have so far not taken them up on this offer  sorry for the long post  I do feel better now I have got that off my chest! Look forward to hearing from you.

Have to say  I m very dissapointed. I live in Wells Somerset and have a small child and it s convenient for me to pop into tesco about once a week. O handed my prescription into the pharmacy and they told me they could hold it for a bit. Went in today with a 7 months old with baby a double ear infection so was unhappy to be told they don t have it. I was shocked at this. They said someone must have collected it. I said they couldn t have. And the lady said I should call the doctor for another prescription. I said I was very unhappy because I know that no one has collected it. She said she could look through everything but would take a while and as I was concerned about it I said regardless of my grumpy baby I would wait. She assured me once again it would be a waste of my time to wait. Nevertheless I did. Within 15 minutes she came back with the prescription I had spend 30 minutes fighting to collect. Think this was very poor organisation and communication and will definalty not be using the pharmacy at any tesco store again!

Re. Tesco’s Opticians  Addlestone I have worn varifocals for over 20 years and have been a customer of Vision Express Opticians for 15 years. I recently had my cataracts removed and now only require reading glasses. I had an eye test at Vision Express but wasn’t happy with the quote they gave me for a new pair of reading glasses  so I took my prescription along to Tesco’s Opticians in Addlestone  Surrey. I was delighted with their quote  especially when I was told that I would receive a 2nd pair free  so  on 8th June  I went ahead and ordered reading specs with transition lenses. I picked them up on 15th June  they were slack and weren’t fitting very well  the assistant held them over a machine that heated them up and I watched while she bent the arms round to make them tighter. I don’t wear the glasses very often  only when I am looking at my computer or reading but after the second day  they still weren’t fitting and slipping down on my face  I then noticed the arm on one pair was loose  so I carefully placed them back in their case and didn’t wear them again until I could manage back into Tesco today to get them fixed.  The same assistant  again held them over the machine and bent the arms to make the glasses tighter on my face  she then tightened up the loose arm. I asked her to tighten it up more because the arm was still loose. She had a look then told me that the arm was damaged so couldn’t be tightened up properly.  As the glasses were only a week old  I expected her to apologise and tell me that she would get it repaired for me  but she had the audacity to accuse me of causing the damage  she actually said I must have sat on them! I was so taken aback  then another older lady came in and asked if any small hands had been touching them  I told her there was only my husband and myself at home (we are both senior citizens)  and  in any case  no-one  but me  touches my glasses. She then said they had been forced  to which I replied  ‘Well  the only person that has been forcing and bending the arms is your assistant!’  Then the older lady said  ‘The end of the arms look like they’ve been chewed!’ She showed them to her assistant  and ignoring me  she repeated  ‘They’ve been chewed!’  By this time I was really upset with their absurd accusations  and replied  ‘So now you are accusing me of sitting on my glasses then chewing them? They rudely replied that they will send them back and the manufacturer will be able to tell! Quite honestly  I am speechless at how unhelpful and unpleasant both these ladies were! I have been a very good customer of Tesco’s stores both at Brooklands and Addlestone for 15 years and have never known any assistants or customer services to be so rude! They need serious training in customer relations! Initially  I was singing the praises of Tesco’s Opticians and the great prices  I was recommending them to my friends  but now I am thoroughly disillusioned and disgusted  your Optician s after sales service is appalling!

Dear tesco s    We regularly shop at your store in Quedgeley  Gloucester  and im sorry to say that we have a complaint. Not so much with yourselves but with some of your inconsiderate customers.   It concerns your trollies. Specifically  the dual child seat twin trollies.  These trollies are great  allowing us to shop one adult per two children with ease! However they are very limited and do not require persons to put in a pound to use them and thus are subject to misuse.   On numerous occasions  almost every visit to be honest  we have witnessed people using these trollies  not only with single kids  but with no kids! We observe people using the child seats to separate their veg  their bakery items  hang clothes  heck even to organise their wine! White in the left seat red in the right! I do not joke!   I assume these people think they are clever  getting away without having to have a pound coin but I think it rather inconsiderate of others. I m sure some innocently did not have a pound coin on them  or forgot their little keyring jobby! Most  I m certain  know jam well what they do  as these trollies are stacked out of the way to the side of the store right to the back! Other people probably don t even know they are there!   You see we have two year old twins. When me and the wife visit the store together and no twin trollies are available it is not so much of a problem  well not for us anyway  we just take a normal trolley and a child each and off we go  getting in everyone s way as we go  taking up double the space in the aisles I m sure annoying many others. It is still however slightly frustrating to see others with no children using them even though its not a massive inconvenience to us.    It is when my wife wishes to visit alone with the girls and there are no twin trollies. This is where we have a big problem. As you can imagine a shopping trip alone with two year old twins is difficult enough even with the twin trolly  nigh on impossible without!! I challenge you to try it!  It s got to a point where my wife literally feels that she cannot visit the store alone through fear of arriving only to find that no twin trollies are available.   I must stress that this complaint is not entirely directed at yourselves  mostly so at the people misusing these trollies.   I must convey deep and utter disappointment to these people and their lack of thought for others.   I ve been close to stopping these people in the middle of the store to demand they swap trollies! If we encounter many more I feel I may snap and start doing so!!   All sattire aside there must be a remedy?   I know it maybe of massive cost for you to implement the idea  but I  as I m sure the other tens of thousands of parents of twins up and down the country  would happily have to put a £2 coin in these trollies  to prevent their missuse. We already pay double for everything else baby related! Why not the trollies too!  Yours respectfully   Ben Austin  Proud father of beautiful twin girls

Michelle was really helpful in finding our receipt on your system using my partner s debit card details; some assistants today would have just told me  no  not without a receipt  and not bothered to go the extra mile. I have walked out with a new pair of shorts for my fiancé  a few bits for me and a smile. Please could you pass my comments onto her manager? I know that some would say she was  just doing her job   but her service was really great and it is always nice to be recognised for hardwork and commitment.   Thank you Michelle.  Regards  Beth

Today I observed in Tesco  one of your employees putting out reduced fruit  and all around him there were at least 15 people. You should know this is a health and safety issue for the employee due to the mobs of people around him  as he is not cornered off. I ve observed this several times. And also I believe  you ve got have a limit of how many items customers can have of reduced products. It gives nobody a fair chance. This is ludicrous  as there is always a mob. Tesco s should ensure safety of there staff and respect for other customer s.

I find your current melon vs pineapple tv advert ambiguous and worrying from a food safety point of view. Could you please clarify the following points: An extract from your Returns Policy states  We ask that perishable food items are returned within their use by date.  First of all what items are included  does this limit itself to raw fruit and veg  or does it include the wider definition: meat  poultry  fish  milk  eggs  and cooked foods? Also  what happens to the returned perishable food items? Do they go back on sale? If so  how can you assure customers that proper refrigeration protocols have not been compromised  especially for ready to eat items  which are naturally the most vulnerable?

Well no surprise Tesco regarding the news today re: loss of jobs & closing of stores etc. No longer competitive with other supermarkets etc. I also dislike the fact that in some smaller stores (NOT Tesco express - I m talking about the store on Stratford Road Hall Green Birmingham) that you are  or have discarded the value range on a lot of your products only to be replaced with what I consider to be a more expensive & inferior quality Tesco branded range!!!! One item purchased recently was mincemeat which previously I would have purchased the  value range  & have never had a problem with either the quality OR the taste  I found that the above store no longer are stocking this & opted for the next cheapest option which I found absolutely awful. It was very fatty & gristly & would NEVER purchase again! Also I find it very difficult to purchase goods with more than a couple of days left on  use by dates  - not so in other supermarkets. So with this in mind Tesco you have lost another customer who has shopped in your stores for many years.

Tesco I have been trying to arrange for home delivery but unfortunately my address has 2 stars next to it (business address or blacklisted from previous tenants) I have called your customer services 5 times now to be told the same information  we will contact the store as it is a store issue to have this changed  this will be changed in up to 72 hours  still I am waiting  if you really don t want me to spend my money in your store please tell me when I call instead of giving me the run around. Im really not happy about your policy on lost keys handed into your stores with a clubcard attached.  The tesco clubcard key ring states on it  If found  please hand into a Tesco Store and we will do our best to return it     I discovered today when enquiring if my lost keys had been handed in  that  doing your best  is keeping them in a drawer on the off chance that someone happens to ask if you have them.  I was told there was no central recording system so I would have to go to each individual Tesco store and see if they have my keys????  A person could hand them in to a store in a  totally different part of the country from where they were found and I would have no way of getting them back. You should absolutely have a central logging system and after a set time  hand to the police who already have a system for contacting those who have registered lost keys.  Or you could get the tesco customers details from the clubcard so why can t you proactively contact the person informing them you have their keys?  I would now actively discourage anyone from having the clubcard key ring on their keys as it appears that it actually decreases your chances of getting lost keys back.  Very irresponsible of Tesco to so publicly offer a  key return service  that is completely unsatisfactory.  I would appreciate any help in working out if any of your Tesco stores happen to have had my keys handed in??

Hi Tesco.  Just how long does it take for a complaint to be investigated?  Initially submitted on 20 February  promised a reply within 14 working days.  10 March  no contact received  promised a reply within next couple of days.  24 March  no contact  promised reply  as soon as possible .  27 March  promised a reply when  colleague is back in office  from annual leave (they had ample time to reply before their annual leave!)  9 April  receive a response that is completely unsatisfactory and generic.  10 April  will respond  as soon as we can .  3 May  advised my responses of 9 and 10 April not sent on  will be  treated as urgent .  6 May  email received with so many inaccuracies  reply sent from me.  27 May  I request an update.  31 May  still no reply  promised a resolution in  up to 14 days .  4 June  they request a meeting - I had already specified written contact only so refused and advised I will escalate if not resolved soon  promised contact  within 14 days . STILL NOTHING OVER 14 DAYS LATER! So it s nearly 4 months now and nothing received.

Yesterday my 2 yr old daughter lost her much loved toy rabbit in your New Milton store. We contacted the shop but was told that it hadn t been handed in as yet. As we were desperate to locate this cherished rabbit  I popped back into the store in the evening & spoke to very understanding lady at customer services who took my name & number & said she d have a look around the store for me. Later that evening I received a message to say that he d been found safe & well!!  My daughter & I went into the store this morning to collect him. We were handed a box with a note attached  saying that rabbit had been looked after over night & has been having a lovely time with his new friends. Inside the box was Jessica s very special rabbit with 3 plastic ducks inside!!  This thoughtful act has proved that a big organisation can still offer a personal touch! Our heart felt thanks to Debbie (wines & spirits dept) and the lovely lady at customer services. Thank you New Milton Tesco ❤️
Thank you Tesco for another fantastic helpful and happy driver :-) (I think your drivers should be given praise as I have not yet found one that isn t) :-)
