I have tried quite a few ready meals from Tesco (of whom I am a big  big fan) and others  and I m finding that the health fad for reducing salt is rendering most of them bland and tasteless.  The latest was Tesco s chicken in mushroom sauce with rice  which I had for a speedy lunch.  There may be an issue with too much salt in things  but enough salt to bring out the flavour would be good.  What s the point of producing dishes that don t taste right?  The good thing is that the salt pot is to hand to bring the taste up to edible.  It s ok for people whose palate is tuned to bland and tasteless food  sometimes for health reasons  and I suppose that it is better to leave it out for those people.  Then the rest of us who like tasty food can add salt.  A most notable exception is Quorn vegetarian cottage pie which Tesco also sell  and this has more body and taste than meaty ones.  Currently on offer until the 21st at £5 for three  if you fancy trying it.

Tesco Metro Levenshulme Manchester Evening News :viewpoints@men-news.co.uk dave.lewis@uk.tesco.com Customer Complaint to the Manager of Tesco Store  Levenshulme I have twice in the last week had occasion to complain about the security guard in Tesco s Levenshulme who on two occasions has validated my age at the self-service till as over 25 with the sale of vodka but has refused point blank to take my bottle to customer services to have the tag removed. I was told that [quote] :  It s not my job . When I called the manager on the first occasion a week ago I was told that he would be  spoken to . Tonight  the same thing happened. I was told to take my bottle of alcohol to the customer services and again told by the security guard that  it was not his job and I could complain if I wanted to . Point1 : I had paid for my purchase so why should I have leave the self service till and take the bottle to be untagged at customer services myself? Previously  before this security guard was employed  all staff took the tagged bottle to customer services to be untagged then returned to the customer at the self-service till. Point 2 : I suspect the problem is that this security guard may be of the stricter islamic faith who strictly observes islamic teaching regarding alcohol. This is fine and I respect his point of view as we live in a free country where everyone is entitled to their political  religious and sexual freedoms. However : There are obviously two sides to this freedom. A customer is also free  in the UK  to buy alcohol. If a member of Tesco s staff feels that touching a bottle of alcohol is against his religion then I woud urge Tesco to redeploy this man in a position where he will not be at risk of contravening his beliefs  to which he is entitled. But I am also entitled  as a paying cutomer  not to be obliged to go out of my way to accommodate religious and cultural beliefs which are alien to me and to which I have a perfect right not to subscribe. In other words  I too have rights. Point 3 : This security guard  when I complained  told me that I could have gone to a manned till or to customer services with my purcheases. My reply : I am paying for my purchases and I will decide where to pay for my goods  not you. Point 4 : I urge Tesco management at Levenshulme to do two things : (1) Not to employ security guards at self-service tills  [especially as this is NOT their designated rôle]  but to instead employ members of staff trained to deal with customers. (2) Not to use staff with religious objections to handling alcohol in positions where they may be exposed to this. This letter of complaint is primarily addresed to Tesco Levenshulme management and I will await their feedback before I send this to Tesco CEO  Dave Lewis and before I publicise this matter further with Tesco Head Office. I think 4 days is sufficicent for a considered reply. Finally  I reiterate that I respect others beliefs but will not accept having to go out of my way to conform to religious sensitivities of those whose beliefs I do not share and are not part of the culture I was brought up in. Alan Entwistle.

Thank you to Baldock Tesco Extra! Despite living in Stevenage where there are two Tesco Extras we regularly drive up to Baldock to do our weekly shop for one reason - there is a basket of fruit for children to help themselves to when they are shopping. As a mum of two young children (a 2 year old and a 12 week old baby) the weekly food shop is not always an enjoyable experience. However when we go to Tesco Baldock my toddler is always excited to pick a piece of fruit and happily tucks in whilst I do the shopping. Such a simple idea but you have no idea how much it can help and avoids so many dramas because she gets bored! Thank you so much Tesco Baldock!! It s a shame more shops do not put in this much effort - shame on them!

At the young age of 61 I recently had a make-up session with Nicola in the Tesco store beauty department Winwick Road. I m converted by Nicola s great  lesson and finished look she did for me. She was patient  listened and talked me through all I needed to know  advising me on which products she thought would be best for me. The result was natural and fresh faced and made me feel lovely. Thank you Nicola. Shame the wedding is not in town I would be in for another session otherwise.

We will not be returning to this store

Big thank you to Tesco & the driver delivering my order 415241512.

Got to say after being a customer for many years and having home deliveries  once or twice a week  how disappointed I was with the service I received yesterday.    After a delayed flight of 2 hrs  we arrived home at 7.30 pm.   Plenty of time for our 8-9 delivery.  My son in law had been there since 6.30 painting  and was there to see us home.    Absolutely starving. We waited and waited.   I finally rang customer service and was told the driver was stuck in traffic.   Considering we had no problem getting from the airport  the time of night and the area we live  I thought this was ludicrous.     We waited another 20 minutes and rang again.    This time to be told by someone else that the driver tried to deliver early and phoned. Absolutely not.   We had no calls . He also said the driver couldn t find us.   We live on the main road!!   I obviously went nuts as that s two different stories and no shopping.   I was told they would rede liver at 11am next day.  I said as we had two disabled people that lived with us and what was u supposed to feed them with after such a long day until then .    I said if they could deliver between 8 and 9 I would accept the delivery but I wanted all the deli products to be re picked as they had been on the van all day.   I was told as they were bar coded that was impossible ! I told him not to bother I would get the shopping myself first thing which I did before 9 this morning.      Imagine our surprise when after 12 along comes the Tesco van with my order.   I chatted with the young man about what had happened and that he would have to take it away as I had all ready got what I needed.   He was rather embarrassed and produced a bunch of flowers which he had been told to give me by his manager.    A nice gesture But does not alter the fact  I had been let down.   Not only by the driver but by the two people I spoke to who both gave me different excuses.      Get your act together  if your going to tell your customers a load of codswallop .

On Friday the 3rd of June I was supposed to get a grocery delivery between 9 - 10 pm. Delivery never showed up  no call  no message  nothing. Once I called  I was told the driver had returned to the depot for unknown reasons. I had to cancel the order  then re-order for the next day (Saturday morning  brilliant - NOT). For some reason they had to cancel my payment for the first order  then take another for the second  but it took 5 days for the money from the first order to be credited back to me. I was told I d get a call and an explanation as to what happened and why the delivery wasn t made. Guess what - never got a call. No call  no explanation  no apology for the inconvenience caused.  Send a message to the  contact us  page for customer service - silence. No answer. Lovely way to treat customers - needless to say I ve started check other supermarkets and will be moving somewhere else for my purchases in future.

Think I will definitely be using an alternative supermarket in the future.

Was in my local Tesco store yesterday which is the AYR24hr store  when to my horror I witnessed a member of staff lifting a bag of frozen chips ot of the freezer and it burst and went all over the floor. T  he seam had let go of the bag  the member of staff then proceeded with ungloved hands to pick up the frozen food put it all back in the bag and putting back in the freezer and walked away  I stood at the freezer for over 10 minutes and had to tell a customer not to take that bag coz it had been all over the floor    I then wentblooking for the member of staff and on approaching her asked to speak to someone in management to inform them of what I had seen ie her dropping the food on the floor then picking it up and putting it back in the bag  the response was I am management and she walked off and totally ignored me.  So if Tesco management have no idea of health and hygiene or food handling protocol theres not much hope for the staff  so long story short keep your groceries Tesco I will never use your store again  I thought I would draw this to your attention to give you an opportunity to respond before voicing my concerns on all forums

I ordered a wine cooler from Tesco on 5th June. I was informed it was in stock and to expect delivery on Saturday 11th June. I waited in all day  no delivery  no contact  nothing. I had also arranged for our kitchen to be completed on Monday to incorporate the wine chiller. I called Tesco who told me that they couldn t contact the delivery company and that they would email them and contact me. I received no contact. I had to contact Tesco AGAIN  who tried contacting the delivery company. I then had to call the delivery company  G2S  myself to arrange delivery and who advised me that Tesco did not provided complete contact details. They advised they now couldn t deliver until the following monday  20th June but they could ask one of their partner companies  Arrow XL  to deliver on Friday 17th June. Arrow XL have just called me to advise that they are unable to deliver the item on Friday because they haven t received the stock from the supplier. I called Tesco to cancel the order and they REFUSED to refund me! I spent £269.00 on this wine cooler which I have not received and Tesco will not refund me. ABSOLUTE DISGRACE.

I have been a loyal customer for many years. I have always left very good feedback regard the customer service i have received from your company on many occasions. However  on this occasion its not such good news.  I have been messed about  passed from pillar to post  spoken down to & literally lied to by representatives from Tesco for the past 3 weeks.  I have been trying to exchange my clubcard vouchers in my local store for nigh on 3 weeks now...... The machines are constantly out of order or require attention. Coincidently  this always seems to be the case around clubcard boost time...?!  hmm..... Customer services  for the most part  at my local store (Dudley) are no help whatsoever one member of staff is particularly rude and unhelpful & im hoping this will be dealt with in a separate complain direct to store.  I was referred to the telephone number specifically for clubcard on Monday (13/06/16) due to the fact the machines would for some unknown reason only print half of my entitlement...... this happened to a friend of mine too.... we were there over an hour trying to resolve the issue and after various attempts to get the machines up and running i was advised to accept the 50% vouchers and call regarding the rest. Upon calling clubcard  I spoke with a gentleman who  for all intents a purposes seemed to know what he was doing..... he dealt with my issue  said he d found the cause  apologised and promise to send out an email with my £50.00 remaining monies owed in the form of a gift card with £5.00 added for my troubles. This email  he said  would be valid for a year from the date of call.... He told me it could take upto 24 hours to receive. I waited........ I waited some more...... I called back ... i was told to give another 24 hours...... I did. Nothing. I called clubcard back on 15/06/16 and spoke with another gentleman who said first gentleman had done nothing..! Zilch!!... Not even any notes on the account  so i had to explain myself all over again....... 2nd gentleman then promised to emulate 1st gentleman s offer.... ok i said  benefit of the doubt i thought..... however  then the guy preceeded to inform me that it wouldnt be valid for 12m after all and would only be until the end of the boost promotion. So   26.06.16. Another 2 days (on top of the 2 weeks trying to print on the broken machines in store....) lost whereby i could have been shopping for goods.  As a result i asked to speak with management . A fella called Jason then came on the line  no surname as usual but a ref of: KI43 given. Again i had to repeat myself and state i wasnt happy with their offer as i felt i was losing out. Everyone else has been able to shop at their leisure  mine would be last minute panic buys at this rate.......  He told me that he would match the offer of £55.00 but it would still have to be used by 26.06.16 so in compensation for the misinformation given  i was offered a further £20.00 added to my clubcard account for future usage. He told me that the card would come  through the post  next day delivery with a receipt date promised for today 16/06/16. To stay home as it required a signature. Fine. after 45 mins on the telephone i obviously had things to do so i accepted and I seemed to be getting nowhere fast anyhow. Today  i waited..... waited... waited...... Post came. No card. Asked postman. No card. I rang clubcard again. i explained predicament again. Have now been informed that next day delivery means 2 days..?!?!?? As day 1 it only gets sent to the postroom and they have to be told exactly what next day delivery is..?!?!  hmm......? So  im then given the track & trace number to check royal mail myself... as if ive not got enough to do already..... I did. They arnt even in receipt of any such parcel/letter....!!!   I now have to take yet another day out of my schedule to wait in tomorrow  in the vain hope it may just arrive  like it was meant to arrive today.....??   As you can no doubt appreciate  im sceptical to say the least..!  I have lost valuble time in which to use these vouchers. MY entitlement as a very loyal customer. Nothing more  nothing less...... nothing for my troubles...... nothing for my time on the telephone........ which incidently amounts to almost 2 hours now..!!!! nothing for the constant brainumbingly repeating myself over and over... nothing for the incompetancy & training issues of your staff...?!!   Nothing for the lies of fella number 1 on Monday.......Futhermore  i have been informed by 2 different members of staff at clubcard that they could have done all this IN STORE a week ago........ but clearly they couldnt be bothered... & im not surprised in all honesty with the lady they have working on that department...!!   Tesco  i am appalled  disgusted and most of all disappointed in you........ but as i have already been told over and over and over again.......  theres nothing we can do.....    Well  im sorry i believe there is & i would very much like an apology  an explaination & some form of compensation.......  Ill await contact from yourselves in regards to this matter. Thank you.

I cannot believe the attitude of the checkout assistant at new milton branch today.  I am disabled and use a mobility scooter and shopping is stressful enough without this kind of attitude.  He could hardly greet me did not offer any assistance and although he could see I was struggling to pack my shopping just keep shoving my items of shopping through.  It was irked when he en had to wait for me to find my club card and then even more when I had to ask him to pass me the machine.  Totally rude and unacceptable  but even more so because of my disability. I went to the customer services and asked to speak to checkout manager who was duly sent for. Just before she arrived someone was stopped on their way out and was then manhandled by approximately 6 store staff and security. When the checkout manager arrived she felt she was surely needed to assist this troublesome customer.  Quite what she was going to achieve I have no idea.  I was spoken to by a supervisor who duly apologised and said staff member would be spoken too.  However  I would say that because of the other commotion I felt my concerns were not quite so important!!!! I am not asking for any preferential treatment because of my disability but just common courtesy would have been good to see by all members of staff!!!!!

A few weeks ago I noticed the tesco free from digestive biscuits had disappeared from the shelves. Those and the ginger nuts were the only  easily available  biscuits my son could eat. I didn t worry and assumed there was going to be a packaging change. How wrong was I. I noticed they were back on the shelves today and so checked the packaging. They now contain soya flour which means my son can no longer eat them.  I know a lot of families who recommended  and relied  on these biscuits being available and who now can t have them. There is no indication that these are a new recipe so unless you check every time someone could be made seriously ill.  Why change what isn t broken?!  It takes so long to find any decent  affordable and tasty food items when you re dealing with multiple allergies. The last thing we need is recipes changing and those simple items being taken away.  I usually commend tesco on their brilliant free from range but this has really annoyed and upset me.
Could you possibly post a list of palm oil free biscuits on sale in your stores  please? To date  I have found Paterson s Shortbread and Tesco Italian Style Breadsticks. Many thanks.

Follow up on the Percentage reduction price of   final day   Fresh Fruit Produce going from 90% off to 70% off . I spoke again with Louise the FFP Manageress . She says a certain number of Tesco stores are taking part in the Food Bank donations . The ones who are are applying the 70% as opposed to the 90% reduction off end of date fruit and veg and then donating what doesn t sell to Food Banks .  My point remains the same . If Tescos want to be seen to  donate to the food banks then they should do so in some other way which does not involve penalising the poor customers who shop in store . Expecting poor people to pay increased reduction price   say eg 54p for two partially rotten advocates is not good . It shouldnt have cost £1.80 for them in the 1st place . Louise and I both commented on how since the 20% increase in reduction price - the end of date FF produce is not selling and the poor customers have taken their minuscule  business to other stores which do the 90% reduction . I ve been told  that Food Banks are not allowed to distribute out of date foods ? As far as the the price war the poor are up against goes     I notice small tub of Lurpack margarine is £3.25 - or two for £4 . Really these prices are ridiculouse . We exist in a world where it has become acceptable and expected for supermarket prices to keep rising .  Whilst all supermarkets can donate to food banks is semi rotten fruit and veg that their poorest customers can no longer afford to buy because they have raised the final reduction price by 20% . Anyone who doesn t appreciate what poverty means please don t comment on this post ...

I am writing to express my concern over the misuse of  Parent and Child  parking bays   and the distinct lack of enforcement.  I visited Tesco Bursledon yesterday with a friend and my infant. As I was strapping my baby in the car  I saw a single male member of staff (wearing a green Tesco shirt and badge) pull in to the Parent and Child bay  get out and walk towards the store. So I say   Excuse me  you seem to have left your baby in the car!  To which he replied   Sorry what?  I said   Well you must have left your child in the car as you don t seem to have one with you.    He then proceeded to laugh at me and walked off so I followed him in and pointed him out to security. The very helpful lady on the customer service desk said she recognised him and would speak to his manager.   On numerous occasions I have witnessed single male and female customers pull up in their sports cars ecg  leaving me to walk across the massive carpark with a small baby and bags in the rain to find a trolly. Each time I have reported this to security and nothing is ever done about it. I would expect security to ask that they move to a regular parking bay but they don t; one time I was even instructed to take pictures and report it myself. This is unacceptable.  Not enough is being done to ensure these spaces are available for people who really need them. This also goes for disabled parking spaces  which I have also witnessed being misused. Tesco has failed me and countless other parents in allowing selfish  entitled people to do as they please. Would that member of staff have parked in a disabled bay to save himself a few extra steps?

Hi Tesco. I would just like to thank you for answering the age old question for me of  Which came first  the chicken or the egg?   Having just visited your Queensbury store and purchasing my usual order of Honey & Mustard Chicken pasta  a Scotch Egg and a drink  I am now absolutely clear on this! It is most definitely the egg as the chicken failed to turn up at all.   Upon opening my usually delicious pasta  I found with distain  that the chicken must have had a previous appointment  as there wasn t any there!   Maybe he was visiting relatives in Kiev or Kentucky  or even Henley on Thames but he definitely wasn t where he should have been  in my pasta. At least I could rely on good old dependable egg to hold the fort until the chicken decided to put in an appearance.   But this seemed a rather poultry substitute by comparison.   I have eaten my pasta  meatless  so I don t need a replacement. This also won t stop me seeking the elusive chicken in my next pasta but could you just inform him when he eventually turns up  that he needs to be a bit more reliable as he is killing the myth that he actually came first.

Dear Tesco. I write because I have lost all faith in your Tesco Direct service  and I am appalled that you seem happy to take my hard-earned money without actually delivering any goods  and in fact  without ever actually notifying me that said goods would not be turning up.  When our old dishwasher decided to bite the dust several weeks ago  we searched around for a replacement. Thinking we had found a good deal  we placed an order on Tesco Direct. Our money was taken and we received an email confirming our order  and advising that we would soon be able to confirm a delivery slot online. All fine so far. However with less than a week remaining until the date our email confirmed the dishwasher would be delivered by  we became concerned that we still could not specify a delivery date or time.  I duly called the number to enquire why this was  only to be told that the dishwasher we have ordered - and paid for in full - was STILL out of stock. Given that we had never once been informed that the product was out of stock  never mind this still being the case  it begs the question - how long are you planning to hang on to our money with no intention of fulfilling our order?  I look forward to your response.

Good evening Tesco   I would just like to let you know how brilliant your staff are at your Bursledon Store Petrol Station. I was a right pain to them this evening and they were great.  Firstly I filled up my car using the pay at pump system  but me being the idiot I am  took the nossle out of my car a bit to quickly  resulting in me spilling a small amount down the side of my car  and consequently  onto the tarmac. I cleaned up my car  and went into the building to inform one of your colleagues of the situtation. She had spotted my mishap and was already on her way out to put sand on the spilt petrol.  I then proceed to leave to petrol station  not realising I had left my purse ON THE ROOF OF MY CAR!! Oops. I didn t realise Until I had driven about half a mile and needed to use it. I immediently backtraced my route back to the station to see if anyone had handed in my purse. Unfortunately not  but kindly your colleagues assisted me to see if it had fallen off within the forecourt  -alas it had not. Your staff then proceed to check the CCTV to see if it was on my car when I had left the station. When they noticed it was  two of them assisted me up the road towards windhover roundabout  on foot  to try and look for it with me.   It was never found  but your staff did a fantastic job trying to help me find it. They definately went the extra mile today. I can remember their names unfortunately (maybe Lynn and Anne??) But they were super  and what made it even better is that  even though I had done two rather careless things  they didn t make me feel bad about it. They just kind reassured me that it happens more often than you would expect.  So yes  SUPER customer service this evening. Thank you.  PS if anyone finds a cream purse with cats on it  thats mine thanks  I don t want to pay for a new drivers  license!

I wanted to drop you a quick note to let you know that over the last 3 deliveries that I have had of my online food order your delivery drivers have been fantastic!!! They have been friendly  helpful professionals that have gone over and above the requirements of delivering groceries. By the time I had finished sorting the squabble  the tea and the dogs she had it all unloaded!  So big thank you to them for the great service  and if there is anyway you can identify the last 3 weeks delivery drivers to pass on my feedback please do 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

As people on here who perhaps know little about the difference about sugar free or diabetic foods should read this.  Or think it s clever to call insulting names. To a diabetic having sugar free foods and drinks can be dangerous to your blood sugars.   Again Tesco I ask you why you you only do a couple of diabetic products.    People with diabetes do not manage their condition by cutting  sugary  foods out of their diet. If you have  diabetes  you can eat sugar-containing foods as part of your overall meal plan  as long as you account for the carbohydrate and calories in the food as part of your overall meal plan. Similarly  if you eat lots of so-called  sugar-free  foods  they may have replaced sucrose (sugar) with sweet tasting substances like sorbitol  mannitol  xylitol  isomalt  and hydrogenated starch hydrolysates. These are all  sugar alcohols   which are technically not  sugar  but are high in carbohydrate. Others may be sweetened with fructose  polydextrose  and maltodextrin  which also contain calories and carbohydrate. These foods will affect your blood glucose just as a sugar-containing food would  in proportion to the grams of carbohydrate in each serving of the food. In addition  foods containing these sugar alcohols can cause stomach discomfort and diarrhea if eaten in large quantities.  Other foods may be sweetened with aspartame or other non-caloric sweeteners like saccharin  acesulfame potassium  or sucralose. These sweeteners contain no carbohydrate. But again  you need to check the food label to see how many grams of carbohydrate are in each serving  because  sugar-free  does not mean  carbohydrate-free.  Some of the foods sweetened with non-caloric sweeteners (like aspartame-sweetened sodas) may indeed have no carbohydrate  and will have no effect on your blood glucose. Others  like an aspartame-sweetened yogurt  still contain carbohydrate (from the fruit or milk products in the yogurt) which must be calculated in your meal plan. These foods contain caloric sweeteners in combination with non-caloric sweeteners.  Work with your dietitian and healthcare team to learn how much of different types of foods you can eat at each meal and snack. Very likely your healthcare team will offer you the opportunity to use carbohydrate counting as a way to use meal planning to manage your blood glucose. In carbohydrate counting  you learn how many grams of carbohydrate you should aim for at each meal and snack. Then you read food labels and use carbohydrate gram counting food lists to figure out how you can  spend  the grams of carbohydrate allocated for a particular meal. You devise your meals based on how many grams of carbohydrate you can eat and how many grams of carbohydrate are in the various foods that comprise a given meal.

Good Morning   So I d really appreciate it if someone could explain what I have just witnessed on my TV Tesco accept returns of anything (even fruit as shown in the advert) with no questions asked! For all you know the box of frozen fish I ve just bought could have been defrosted  opened  touched. For all you know the oranges I ve just bought could have been injected with something nasty or dipped in a chemical. For all you know the fresh chicken I have just bought was actually left out of refrigeration for 24 hours and in direct sunlight for 8 of those hours.   How do you know? And how are you going to rectify this when someone gets sick  someone s child gets sick  someone dies?   You might think I m being extreme so by all means try to explain to me the safety measures you have in place so this doesn t happen.   In the meantime I will not be shopping at Tesco like I have for the past 5 years and will encourage my friends and family to do the same! I m fully aware that making a complaint about one of your colleagues is totally pointless as your company will always side with them. However what happened today was absolutely unforgivable . I went through to your self checkout  and scanned and bagged all my items. I started to pack the bags underneath my buggy as I have a bit of a walk home. I had about 5 bags with me. Obviously this set off the  item removed from bagging area  alert. So I waited for a colleague to come over. When she did she said she wanted to see all my bags. I asked why as the screen only states item removed from bagging area and I was finished with packing anyway. She then accused me of having an unexpected item in my bags. I pointed out that the screen clearly states item removed from bagging area. I also pointed out that the guy next to me had a prompt like that and she didn t treat him the way she s treating me and she also didn t go through all his bags. She refused to listen and still demanded that she go through all my bags. She calls a colleague over and I am standing there as her and another lady are going through all my bags and making sure every single item is scanned (Mind you I had 5 bags full of items) Everyone is staring at me. At this point I lose my patience and tell them I refuse to stand there while they  treat me like I m thief and said I wanted to leave all my groceries and just take my babies food. And tell them they can cancel everything else off.  I grab the bag full of my babies food and go to another self check out  to scan it in again. And they are still standing there going through all those bags to make sure I didn t actually steal anything. I ve gone through your self checkout atleast 4-5 times a week and every time I ever got an alert like that the person always came over punched in their code and let me continue what I was doing.   I went to your customer service desk and spoke with  the deputy manager and of course she sided with her. Was not even interested in my side of it. She said she would speak to the colleague and walked away  I asked how she planned to do that when she never even asked me who the colleague was.   The only thing I can think of to as why your colleague treated me the way she did is maybe  she thinks I look dodgy because I am heavily tattooed which is just stupidity on her part.  I know  that me no longer spending £300-£400 a month in your store isn t exactly going to effect you financially  but there is no way I will ever step foot in your store again out of principle
Have you discontinued your Eco Naturally Powered products? I can no longer see them on online ordering.

Hi Guys   I would just like to say a massive thank you to the Manager of Banbury Store today  his name was Simon. When entering your store we were greeted by a sweet looking old lady offering samples of British Butter. My sister is Muslim and as its Ramadan she can not eat anything until later. I respect that so don t eat in front of her when we are out together. When we politely declined the offer of said butter the return comment from the lady was  oh  you don t like British then ...!  Now both my sister and myself are born and breed in England so the only thing that would make us different to everyone else that declined the offer would be my sisters headscarf. After a moment of shock we asked her why we wouldn t like British but got no reply. I am a nurse and have a lot of respect for the older generation but this comment was totally unacceptable. I asked to speak to the manager and along came Simon. We repeated the situation and he was fully supportive of our shock. He dealt with the issue immediately and asked the lady to leave. My sister often receives comments like this being a convert but I have never witnessed any company jump to her defence is such a remarkable way. He is a credit to your company and felt you needed to be made away. We left the store feeling respected and welcome.  Thank you Simon

I have just done my shopping at your Littlehampton branch as I do every week when to my surprise the cashier wanted to charge me for one of your small produce bags which I was going to use to wrap my frozen prawns. When I asked why she explained that it is the law if bags are not being used for fresh products such as meat veg etc.  When I said that Morrisons do not charge for their small plastic bags the cashier explained it is because yours have handles.  I bumped into one of you managers on the way out and asked why do you bags have handles when other supermarkets don t and they do not charge.  He said that the cashier was wrong and that Morrison s were breaking the law!!!! I have since checked on the governments website and yes indeed all bags with handles are chargeable so this means that your cashier was correct on NOT your manager (who I suggest needs to be updated on this law!!) I strongly object to paying 5p for a minuscule plastic bag meant for wrapping not for carrying  and maybe Tesco should do the same as other supermarkets and NOT have handles on their wrapping bags and if this is not possible a sign warning people that they will be charged might be appropriate.  I would also like to know who pays for the bags that people leave in the trolly in the carpark and the ones flying about!! Also this is the first time since the law was changed that I have been asked to pay for a wrapping bag!!!  By the way I refused to pay so the cashier then had to throw away the bag which was now contaminated.

Yesterday My shopping was delivered and everything was fine until last night when my son realised his Large tobacco hadnt been in with the shopping...after checking and rechecking we rang Tesco Help line..a Woman named Sophie answered the phone...She listened to what i had to say and asked me if my son needed his tobacco right away...i told her he had run out altogether and she asked me to wait a half hour and she would get back to me...I thought yeah sure you will...Anyway...exactly 30 mins later the phone went and it was Sophie...she informed me that she has been talking to the manager of my local store..(Cradley Heath) and said unfortunately the last van had already left but the manager would deliver it to my door himself...and that exactly what he did 15 mins later..So Thanks Sophie and thank you to the manager for being so helpful...10/10 for customer satisfaction...

Thank you Tescos for delivery my 2kg of potatoes on the day they go out of date. Yeahp...delivered them on the 9th June  when they expire the 9th June. Not sure why you think I can eat 2kg of potatoes in 1 afternoon/evening? That s a lot of starchy carbohydrates

Dear Tesco  I am currently sitting in your Haverfordwest branch having a breakfast in your café with my 2 1/2 year old son as has been our weekly treat and somewhat tradition for the past year. I have loved this daddy/son time but am now writing to inform you we will not be returning after today. I understand that menus are updated and change however today I was informed that instead of the usual egg/beans/sausage that my son usually has you now have a minimum of 5 items on a child s breakfast and I would be charged for 5 even if I didn t want them! I m not sure what your aim is? Do you intend to make extra profit on my time with you by charging for items I don t want? Do you intend for me to take the items I pay for and not eat them contributing to the growing food shortage that our planet is facing and adding to food waste when my 2 year old cannot eat a massive meal  or is it simply that tesco are supporting childhood obesity?? I would be very curious to hear your views on this!   Very disappointed   Tim Morphew

I ve just had great service from your contact centre. I needed to delay my food order until this evening due to an issue with my freezer and this was sorted in no time for me by Rebecca at the contact centre and Lisa at the store. Considering the fact that I once tried to do this with Asda and they said they would have to take the payment of my shopping again to do it (I d obviously get one charge refunded within a few days but didn t have enough money in my bank to make the payment again) I m really impressed that this was resolved so easily by Tesco.

Tesco  Tring Road Aylesbury. Visited last night with husband. Half the car park lights were out last night  makes it unsafe as carpark tarmac has potholes and you cant see where your walking. If someone has an accident or worse gets attacked you ll have a lawsuit headed your way.  Heads up!

I went shopping in tesco with my son (who has aspergers and is partially sighted)  I use a wheelchair. We went to use the lift in the store and when I pressed the lift button the doors opening and a youngish man was inside. The lift was already on the ground floor so he had just been standing inside. He said   I wouldnt go in that after what its just done . I took it with a pinch of salt - he seemed a bit strange and thought maybe the lift had jolted when it had reached the floor as they often do.My son and i went into the lift expecting the man to exit which he appeared to be doing  but he came back into the lift with us. He then pressed all the buttons not just the next floor button and the lift started to go up. A few seconds later the lift became stuck. I felt quite worried as he was behaving oddly. He then kept pressing all the lift buttons and banging on them and trying to open the lift doors. He wasnt panicking. He said he wanted to be an otis lift engineer and he could re-boot the lift. He seemed to me to be either autistic or he had been smoking something he was decidedly odd and I felt very threatened. I pressed the lift alarm button expecting it to keep ringing until someone answered. It did make a loud noise but no one seemed to be answering. I tried to call the store on my mobile but there was no signal. I may sound trivial but I was becoming quite worried and did feel threatened.  I then tried 999 as it seemed the only option and told them I was stuck and also that i felt threatened -- bit awkward when the threat is stood right next to you.  They put me through to the fire brigade and i explained etc and they were going to attend then at that point someone spoke on the intercom and we said we were stuck and they just said they would sort it and disappeared. To me this just left me with no communication with anybody. The fire brigade said oh you will be sorted and went off the line. After what seemed an age but was probably ten minutes the lift slowly moved back down and the doors opened and we left the lift. The odd guy stayed in the lift. I thought maybe somebody would be outside the lift but there was no one there. My son and I went to the security at the front of the shop to explain and tell bout the guy still messing in the lift. Nobody seemed aware in the shop that we had been stuck but apparently the pharmacy guy had eventually heard the alarm and told the manager but we were out by then.  Apparently the alarm contacts head office who control the lifts and they eventually contact someone in the store.  I was quite distressed traumatised and upset by it all.  I phoned my daughter to bring my husband to drive the car and me home as I felt a bit in shock by it all.  My husband spoke to the manager and he said they had never had anybody stuck in the lift before and had no precedures in place properly.  I could have had a heart attack in it and nobody would have been able to be contacted easily its crackers. You would think as well with terrorism and all sorts that there would be more safety procedures in place He ( manager) is looking into it to see about having the alarm ring directly to his office or somebodys office so they can deal with it quickly and look into the communication with the people in the lift while they are stuck I was more concerned about being stuck with a possible nutcase rather than the lift now actually working The guy was still messing about with the lift when we left the store

I am extremely disappointed and traumatised after being stuck in the lift in Tesco  the procedures for helping anyone stuck are diabolical and unsafe. I am a wheelchair user and my son (who has aspergers and is partially sighted) was with me and there was another young man in the lift who was behaving oddly to say the least and I was quite frankly terrified.
Hi was just wondering if you had a list of dairy free products available

Hi Tesco    I just wanted to ask a really quick question.   When you re giving back these clubcard points- for loyalty- for things such as hotels.. When you advise on your website that customers must call to enable them to use their vouchers  do you think you should enlighten customers that  in fact by calling  they ll have used their lovely loyalty rewards & would be best spending their vouchers elsewhere.  £10 for a simple phone call to book a room at Novotel! Yikes! When i asked Tesco on Twitter I was advised that they should tell me this- nada  & to go direct to the company. Novotel stated that it s my due to ask if the call was a costing call. Now  with all due respect tesco  we are a nation of unlimited calls. We dial & unless stated  we think it s free. We wouldn t specifically ask as  most  companies notify you at the beginning of this call. Or they expect it d be minimal cost given that it s coming from a company that expressed their value as  every little helps  meaning to save money! So  my question to you  Tesco is this;  Do you think it s right that you advertise this number for your loyal customers  only to be conned the other side of the phone call?! Your go!   Yours sincerely    A future Sainsbury s customer at this rate

Hi I received my online delivery Wednesday but was told by the driver the freezer section of his van had broken so I couldn t have my freezer items. I said that was terrible as I now have to drive to the store to buy all my freezer food so he said he d get a manager to call me back. I ve heard nothing since except I received an email yesterday saying my food items had been refunded  nothing about my delivery refund and no call back  very bad customer service.

I have received my online order and one of the items was a Tesco cheese and tomato pizza. We have notice something very  un-usual in this pizza. The pizza was wrapped with a insect (large dead moth). I wrote the email and attached the photos as requested but got no response nor by phone or email  two days later made a call again then got put through to the store manager who arranged a collection of the disgusting pizza. Still no reply to the email. This is one of the worst customer services I have seen. So much for taking matters seriously  I am still awaiting a refund for my order.Now tesco have my pizza and my money. What kind of practice do you have in customer services? Under sales of goods act you are in breach by selling good of unsatisfactory quality.

Absolutely disgusted with my service today at the hartlepool branch! Picked my younger sister (16) up from home to go shopping for tea after work and part of my shop was alcohol! It is my consumers right to purchase alcohol if I am of age!!!!!  5 minutes later I returned with my mam and went to the customer service desk to complain but after a few ignored calls from management  I left. Meanwhile  my mam and younger sister had been to the till and purchased the alcohol despite them BOTH not having ID!  So basically  my understanding is that you would serve me if I was older OR if I had young children with me! Assuming I wasn t buying alcohol for my children!   That is discrimination and I am absolutely livid. I would like a valid explanation as to why this would happen! Not to mention the lack of help from management and me having to leave the store with no help at all on my issue!  I will not be shipping at tesco again!

I need to thank Lewis from you Royston Express store today for cheering me up. I was very excited to be picking up the birthday presents I ordered from Tesco Direct ready to wrap for my daughter s 2nd birthday tomorrow. Her three older brothers were looking forward to helping me put her new slide together ready for the to play on in the morning.  I had an e mail saying that all the items had been dispatched and then an e mail saying 2 items had arrived  off I went to pick them up albeit a day later than they arrived at the store. I heard nothing about the third parcel which was the slide.  I got there to find Lewis who got together all my parcels minus the slide. I was about to call Tesco Direct to see where it was when he said he would call them on my behalf. The slide was missing somewhere thy couldn t tell me where but couldn t get one to me until tomorrow afternoon.  I think Lewis realised my disappointment and realised that it wouldn t be my little girl who would be upset  after all she will only be 2 tomorrow but the disappointment was mine  that I couldn t bring her downstairs tomorrow morning to see her shiny new slide. Lewis then handed me a gift to apologise on Tesco behalf  this gift was for me as Lewis s customer service is so excellent he realised I needed cheering up  not little Clara!   Lewis then carried my other packages to my car.  Thank you Lewis you are a credit to Tesco your service went above and beyond and you really cheered me up.

Tesco can I ask why you put things that are not in a  meal deal  in the meal deal section?  For instance you have coca cola vanilla on special offer buy two for two pound. Same red label coke bottle but with slightly different colour to the writing. Big yellow label promoting the aforementioned deal. Right next to regular coke which is part of the meal deal for 3 quid?  You do the same with the water and the crisps. It s ridiculous.  Separate everything in the meal deal to one section. Or use a different colour label to highlight items in the meal deal. This whole process stinks. Which at busy times people in a rush are just going to accept. Stop your cowboy tactics tescos. No wonder people are choosing to shop elsewhere.  You have gone from the store that would do anything for their customers to make shopping better cheaper and a nicer experience into a mafia of retail intent on extracting every possible penny. Shame on you

So  thanks so much Tesco!  Last night I had a delivery shop booked for 9-10pm  it was the only slot I could do  as I was leaving the house at 7.30am  and not getting home til 9.15pm (my Mum was there babysitting from 8.30  so would be available to take in my delivery) AT 10.10pm  having heard nothing from you about the whereabouts of my delivery  I contacted your customer services  a lovely girl called Sophie called the store to get the drivers phone number  and attempted several times to contact the driver for me  with no luck!  At 10.40pm she called me back to let me know she d had no luck  and I was to assume my shop wasn t coming  but to wait up til 11 just in case (such great news for me when I d been up since 5am!!) She re-booked my shop to come today  but unfortunately the earliest that I can be here for it is 1-2pm slot  not a lot of use to me when the contents of my delivery included items that were needed for breakfast today  and for my sons packed lunch for school today!!!  And to top it all  she informed me that I would also be recharged for this amended delivery and then later refunded the original  not great when I m a single mum on a very tight budget  I have it  just  but it s going to leave me on a knife edge while I await the refund!  At no point in this did the store/driver ever contact me to warn me my delivery may be delayed/not arrive  and no one has bothered to apologise for the significant inconvenience of a) being charged twice  b) waiting up that late when I ve been up working all day  and c) will now have to be at home this afternoon waiting again  when I d had plans I ve now had to cancel  as I need the shopping  or there will be no dinner tonight!!  So thanks Tesco  thanks for that whole bunch of nothing I m now having for my breakfast!!
Nice to see you still putting profit before workers

So my shopping was supposed to be delivered tonight between 8 and 9  at around 8:36 I received a missed call from a mobile unfortunately I missed the call as I was settling our youngest  I waited a moment to see if I got a voicemail........ Nothing........ So I tried calling the number back..... No answer  I looked up our lane to see a Tesco delivery man walking up another drive  this is not close enough for me to get your delivery drivers attention! He then drives off...... No further call! Nothing! So at 9:10 I call your helpline and get told I will receive a call within 30 minutes...... Now at 9:49 nothing! Now this wouldn t usually be an issue  however on this occasion my order contains items including a birthday cake and birthday items for my son who s 7th birthday is tomorrow! So because you incompetent driver couldn t see past the end of his nose and realise the lane continued and attempt to leave a voicemail and even ring more than once (I m sure others miss calls too) I don t know when I m going to be getting my order! This needs sorting ASAP! Fuming doesn t cover how I feel right now

I have heard that for Easter 2017 that your stores will not be using Easter in the  Easter eggs  displays any longer as it offends other religions. Well I am offended that you will stop calling them  Easter Eggs  as it is Easter and it has to do with Jesus and Easter is what the holiday is called for a reason and it is part of my religion as it is part of Christianity. So you feel it okay to offend the people of the UK who were born and bred in this country and who s forefathers fought for this country and have the religion of Christianity  yet you will not call  Easter Eggs  exactly that because you are afraid that it will offend other religions. This is an absoloute disgrace and I for one will certainly not be continuing to shop at your store. I am completely offended by this ad I am sure many others are. If we went to another country we would have to follow their way of life and respect their religion so why should other people of other religions not respect our way of life and our religion. Absolutely pathetic  you should keep calling them  Easter eggs  as that is exactly what they are as it is an Easter holiday for a reason.

My pet insurance has increased by £13 per month  i phoned and queried to be told that even though I have not claimed for years I will receive NO extra services  cover or benefits for this increase. Can someone tell me why after years of loyalty  paying on time every month and not claiming I deserve to be treated like a cash cow for the fat cats of the board. I can get the same cover at a fraction of the cost but am told that I am past the point of no return to make changes even though I have not received any correspondence or renewal paperwork. I can only assume that your  every little helps  banner line should read  every little overprice helps us . I look forward to hearing your response.

Appalling customer service received from Tesco today. Due to coming out of hospital  I processed an online order last night as we had absolutely nothing in the house. As my partner works in Oxford  we live in the countryside and I m not even allowed to walk very far or drive  the online method of shopping should have been the most convenient option.   The order was due to arrive between 3-4 pm today and  at 4.30pm I decided to contact customer services as there was no sign. Customer services said that for some reason my order had been sent from Sunbury (120 miles away  as I live near Bristol) and they didn t no why. A local store provided a care package of essentials at 7.30pm however  could not provide full order as it was not reprocessed by customer services. Rang cust services again and they tried to reprocess it and it STILL attempted to deliver from the Sunbury store. Aaron then advised me to put the whole order in again from scratch  with no guarantee that it would link with my nearest store. I explained this would be extremely incovenient as I m currently unwell  especially without guarantee of successful delivery. Subsequently  I informed Aaron I d order my groceries through a competitor as there was no alternative that could be provided. I attempted to log this as a formal complaint with Aaron and requested details of the complaints procedure and was told that a response time couldn t be provided.   All I have been told today is that his has never happened before and it was an IT issue however  this doesn t solve my current situation of being without a grocery order  at the time I have requested  as I am unable to go to a shop. To be advised that the care package and a £10 e-credit is suffice compensation is ridiculous  when I am still without may items required for the remainder of the week. Additionally  as I can t process my online order through Tesco  and I will be using a competitor  the e-credit is worthless. I would like to know what Tesco are going to do about this almighty shambolic excuse for convenient shopping and customer service.

Quite disappointed with Tesco today. I applied for a job  answered all the screening questions  uploaded my birth certificate as proof of nationality and right to work  only to be rejected as it wasn t the A4 size full birth certificate. It is MY birth certificate  the one my parents got when they registered my birth 41 years ago. So how come it s not good enough for you Tesco? Now I have to send off for my full birth certificate if I want to work for you? Thanks for putting a barrier in my way to find work.

I contacted you yesterday regarding an incident with my son to which I am still waiting a satisfactory response. Your usual template reply just isn t going to suffice this time I m afraid and as a (ex) loyal customer I m angry and disappointed at how we were approached by one of your security staff ordering my 15 year old son who suffers severely with anxiety  is on the autistic spectrum and recovering from agrophobia to remove his hood which he wears all the time to make him feel safe. He did not say  excuse me  we have a policy etc  he rudely said  hood.. take it down  motioning for my son who had a communication disorder to remove the only thing that allowed him comfortably to be stood in a busy supermarket  something that is a colossal challenge to him. Apparently no hoods are allowed to be worn in your stores because it prevents identification... except his face wasn t covered and he was needlessly embarrassed and distressed in public. However if he headwear on for religious or cultural reasons he wouldn t have been approached. How about personal or medical reasons? Elderly ladies in scarves? Hats? Where do you draw the line? I can understand helmets or bandanas but a boy shopping with his mum? I have provided all the details twice now and would really like to know what has been done to prevent further similar unnecessary treatment of your customers with mental health problems and suggest you review your unfair clothing policy. Where are the signs on the door? Also if you need to speak to someone  you should quietly take them aside. Just really disappointed with this and with being ignored. Your mission is to  treat people how they want to be treated  what a joke.

Tesco - please send help. I ve been on a long and perilous quest to find and conquer the elusive Tesco clubcard. I ve tried in vain to lure one through my letter box for many years now  I even tried bribing the postman with dog biscuits  I hear they like those. Alas  he wasn t privvy to the secrets of attaining the precious Tessco Clubcard.   I was strong willed at the beginning of this journey  but sadly I ve grown weak and bitter through lack of clubcard points  I almost rugby tackled a woman last Tuesday for rubbing it in my face that she was purchasing so much avacado and spinach for free using her points.   Goodness knows why one would spend precious clubcard points on nasty green tree eggs  doesn t she know what I d give for such points!?  My car is so desolate without the fuel top ups I ve been promising her for years  one day I keep telling her  I ll lavish you will all the petrol points.   In all seriousness Tesco - what s a gal gotta do for a clubcard? I ve signed up for one three times now and have never been sent a card. Think of all the tree eggs that I could have bought considering I shop there weekly. They think I don t want them. Well  I don t want them but we mustn t let them think that. Please Tesco  end my quest and send a clubcard through my door? (preferably loaded with three years worth of missed points but I m not too fussy)

I recently ordered a food shop from Tescos. The food shop included a bag of Tesco Petis Pois. Upon having cooked the peas in a saucepan and sat down to ate them  I noticed a rather odd looking pea. Very unhappy about this...  I took photos too :)

Im not normally one to put things like this but would just like to thank the staff at failsworth tesco!!! Firstly after being in the store for 5 minutes I got an announcement for my car registration to go to customer service. When I got there I had been told someone had come off their motorbike and ran into the back off my car in the torrential rain. As the rain was so bad I didn t want to take my baby out to check the car so the customer service ladies said they would keep an eye on him whilst I got the details. They were lovely.  Secondly as the rain was bad one of the gentlemen got me an umbrella (which he couldn t get under so got soaked) and came outside with me to check the car.  Then once I had actually done my shop the whole front of the store had flooded so they were letting people out the side exits. As my car was in the child space at the front entrance I had no choice but to go out this way. (This point the water was above my ankles). One of the ladies helped me get my shopping out to my car even though she herself had to step out and have water upto her ankles and still have to work with wet feet and pants. They also wrapped my baby in a towel so he kept dry and gave me one to put over my head.  As they didn t forsee what would happen in the torrential weather they acted very quick and were very patient with everyone. Although I am now sopping wet and home I would like to thank all the staff for there help!! 😊😊😊.

Received outstanding customer service from the delivery driver of my home shopping order today.  The fresh chicken I ordered was flagged up as the use by date was Friday. I am very impressed that he did this for me and have notified your customer services team by telephone so that he gets the recognition he deserves! :-D 🚐 👍 :-D

I am a regular Tesco s shopper and I do enjoy the flexibility of returning goods such as Clothing or Technical equipment etc that may not be to the standard expected upon purchase. The current advertisement showing the range of returns now available has caused alarm bells to ring; as it shows a woman returning home after her shopping and deciding she would prefer a Pineapple rather the Watermelon. She goes back into store and does a swap!   Im sorry but i dont feel that any type of food should be returnable under  any  circumstance especially a change of mind once home. This is a violation of Health & Safety Concerns; considering the world we live in I dont trust anyone at all to take home a piece of fruit or other foods to be returned and possibly mishandled or worse injected with anything harmful or life threatening.   Yes some may argue  well we eat out or bring home takeaways; how can we trust them  in my defence at least I have the assurance that the person providing the food is known to me and I would trust this person/s more than some random could be psycho want to hurt people deliberately.   Well this has really made me reconsider shopping at Tesco s.   These are  my  concerns and obviously everyone else may have their own reservations which may be positive or in my case negative.

8 JUN 2016 — With less than 3 weeks until long serving colleagues wages are cut and the silence from the top is deafening. Colleagues have had no formal letters informing them how much money they will lose each month. There are people worrying about how they will survive and they have had no confirmation of exactly how much worse off they will be. There is talk that one to one meetings will commence after the 16th June? This is disgraceful these pay cuts are due to take place from July 3rd and colleagues have had no confirmation from Tesco about who is affected and how badly.  You have to ask   Are Tesco deliberately leaving it as late as possible because the losses are higher than they have indicated?Are they deliberately delaying so that there will be minimum bad publicity as a result of these pay cuts?  Come on Tesco at least show your long standing loyal workers a small bit of respect by giving them the vital information they need so they can make decisions about their future.  Or better still DON T CUT COLLEAGUES PAY!

Last night  having tried 3 other places including a rival supermarket  I ventured over to my local Tesco in the hope of purchasing a packet of Endekay disclosing tablets. Those tablets you chew to show how dirty your teeth are. I wasn t bothered by brand  just needed the tablets  There are none on the dental aisle  so went to the pharmacy. The two members of staff were unsure what I was asking for initially  and then the pharmacist said she had never sold them before  and then laughed and said  Oh I m looking at them!  and retrieved a box from under the counter. She handed me them and asked if that was what I was after. It was! Yippee  I thought  at last we can buy them. For some reason the product wasn t priced  and I was asked to go and do my shopping whilst they located the details on the system. I had no shopping to do  but when faced with rows and rows of food  two children and it being evening  I was tired and easily worn down into purchasing items we really probably didn t need  apart from a bunch of bananas! After a long walk around  I returned to the pharmacy and was told that they couldn t locate the price on the system and so couldn t sell it  the product was being removed from sale and to return this afternoon or leave a telephone number IF i wanted to speak about it. Well  I have to admit I was annoyed  and more annoyed that if I had been told this straight away I may have had time for one final dash to another place which may have sold them. I needed the tablets for this morning. You made a bit of a healthy profit out of my shopping last night but you have one miffed customer who finds  it intriguing you have items in stock with no price. Also intrigued a pharmacist would not understand what I was asking for  I had to give a long description and in the midst of all that she walked away to serve another customer!  I do have a bunch of bananas though..........

I have recently taken the Tesco satisfaction survey and would like to highlight a few areas and ask a couple of questions.   My personal online shopping experience with Tesco has been overall very positive but I would like to be able to purchase things from the superstore  such as more American goods and Krispy Kreme products  through online shopping.   I have health problems that keep from shopping in person  so this would be an excellent improvement.   Also  I have disabled friends who love the customer service from Tesco. He took it back in and was told by the security guard to come back tomorrow because customer services was shut  despite the fact he had a receipt from 5 minutes before in his hand. My brother tried to explain why (which I shall explain further) this isn t an option  and the security guard responded with  well I have to get on a bus to get to work from Cowes  which is entirely ridiculous  irrelevant and rather rude ...My mum lives on the other side of the island and has very restricted mobility  and coming back the next day isn t an option  it s 8 miles away (in Cowes)  and she comes late at night to avoid the crowds. I find his response very interesting when your recent advert shows you will  exchange a watermelon for a pineapple  but apparently your security guard won t allow an exchange to a faulty bag of litter (which would make a mess over the car)  that s ripped open! Maybe you should add * in office hours only * and offer return petrol or fares  if an item is faulty outside of office hours. What do you think? I took the wife s car to Tesco petrol station in Northwich  Cheshire  It s a diesel and mine is a petrol. I automatically picked the petrol up but realised before I even put it anywhere near the car.  As I moved the nozzle to replace it and pick the right one up the readout suddenly jumped from £0.00 to £0.06! No fuel had been dispensed  not even by accident. I called the big guy out to the pump who said  it wasn t unusual and some times the pump read the trapped fumes ?!?   According to the station worker it  happens all the time ! I know it s only six pence but I think it s unacceptable. We pay enough for fuel already.   According to trading standards:  the internal volume of the hose can change due to internal pressure forcing more fuel into the hose. This effect is called ‘hose dilation’ and is simply the hose swelling slightly. The error in such cases  if any  is very minor and well inside the permitted pump error tolerances of -0.5% to +1.0% !  This was not within the permitted pump error tolerances and I hadn t even started to pump fuel.

So off we went  as she had been good all day. I am at the till with all my shopping and realise that after scanning everything I had left my purse at home. So my daughter that had clutched this ice cream the whole way around the shop  was now looking at me totally heart broken when I said she couldn t have it.  So she is now crying  I am literally on the verge of crying  when the customer service lady sees I am clearly struggling and offers to help me  I explain the situation. And she then crouches down to my very upset 2 year old and asks what s wrong  I explained about the ice cream to which she replies  well we can t have that  you come all this way and your not going to get your ice cream  you just wait here   She then produces a ice cream for my daughter and say  enjoy it    So now I am crying but with utter happiness and disbelief at what had just happened.  The cost to tesco was 50p the cost to me and my little girl is priceless. And I will Never forget.  Thank you

To Tesco  Giles  Martin (I think that s his name!) and Ali - I cannot thankyou enough.  I went into the Launceston supermarket today (05/06/16) to stock up on groceries. I got to Martins checkout at about 3.55pm (just when the store was about to close) and realised I d lost my card - my only method of payment. I explained to Martin that I should go check for it in my car  so he held the shopping at the checkout. On my way to the car  I explained my situation to Giles (who I think was a store manager). Despite all of my panic  Giles made me feel human again  telling me about a recent time when he d lost his card and reassuring me it wasn t going to be an issue. He then told me the store would pay for my shopping  whilst we looked for the card. Not only did the store pay for my shopping  but Martin packed my shopping and even brought it to the door for me. After a quick search of the shop  Giles checked for my card at the customer services counter  which had already been closed for the day. It had been recorded that it had been handed in. I m so incredibly grateful for the finder of the cards honesty. The customer services worker  Ali  who was just about to go home  set down her bags and reopened the safe where it had been locked away.  Amongst all of this  what Giles  Martin  Ali  the finder of my card and tescos didn t know was that these groceries were going home to stock up the emptying cupboards of my Dad and I - My Dad has dementia and I am a student nurse on placement and in exam season. I cannot explain how much  these multiple acts of kindness have blessed and have helped us. You have completely changed my perspective of supermarkets. Dad and I are so overwhelmed and so grateful by all of the kindness shown and we ll think of you during our mealtimes this week! Thankyou  thankyou  thankyou.

Dear Tesco.   I am really sad to be writing this post. (I m not in any physical pain but I feel if I don t let out my emotions it could lead to that). Upon entering the store I could see nothing else but what my dreams entail. Shining out to me like a star in the night sky. Hello. I see you. The Chicken Chorizo Wrap (No Mayo). I sprint  like a gazelle. Shirley from round the corner doesn t matter at this moment in time  she s getting floored. That sandwich is mine.   The first bite is succulent  and I think  Today is going to be a good day .   Now  to the sad part of this story. I cannot seem to find this wondrous wrap anywhere  has is been discontinued? I thought Tesco had good customer service  NOW I m convinced otherwise!!! My wife booked a lovely 1week stay self catering in Dorset.My wife spent a long time ordering our good n drink for the week online with tesco and was due to be delivered between 8-9 pm.We were in our accommodation from 5.30 onwards.After 8.30 had passed I thought I would phone and check  That that the driver could find us this is when i found out I had no phone or wi fi service. So walked off site till I could get a phone signal to phone customer helpline.I was told delivery had been attempted and failed  and returned to store .The man I spoke to said that they would attempt to redeliver on an Emergancy delivery slot and would come later I gave full instructions and waited till 10.45 before walking off site again to to phone again to be told that there would be no delivery and that it was not down at all to be delivered!!! She offered a morning delivery but I refused as I was so angry and disappointed  with Tesco. I had to ring again as I realised that pay ment had been taken and was told that this would take 3-5 working days ??? Due to this inferior service we have had no food for 13 hours and only water to drink.  We had ordered £172.18 worth of food and drink for our weeks stay and I m now sat outside MORRISONS with our 2 dogs while my wife is shopping when we should be relaxing enjoying the start of our holiday.  I don t believe enough effort was made to deliver our shop as there are places he could ve gone to for directions and our accomadation is easy to find and I gave directions when I phoned even giving our car description to make it easer Only to be told later there was never an intention to redeliver at all. One woman I spoke to gave me a £10 voucher which I find insulting after all this.  Had I been told it wasn t gonna be delivered I could have driven to Tesco to pick it up.  Also we have had to Pay out again for food do places and things we were gonna do we now can t because we have less money.  The whole experience has been upsetting and left us feeling angry and unimportant Tesco I feel did not offer or deliver good service for which I know they strive for.   Not happy  Paul Smith

Dear tesco phone care  my nan holds a contract with you and have an attached phone for my sister. Last October my nan unfortunately suffered a massive stroke  leaving her with speech  communication and physical impairments. Now  we have been trying since Christmas to change over the contract from my nan into my sisters name  as she is no longer able to manage the account financially. Your company are still attempting to take payments from an expired card  causing her payments to reject and effect her credit rate  you d think considering the special circumstances a company of your size and popularity would be understanding and help us out....we have been met by nothing but unhelpful staff refusing to help! We have even carted my nan in her wheelchair to our local tesco where we were turned away by one of your un helpful  un friendly staff! Quite frankly tesco  you have failed on EVERY level possible. Yours faithfully annoyed and let down ex-customer

Tesco  tesco  tesco how you have let me down.   As a parent with two children  that can be best described as the omen crossed with Dennis the menace. I find myself occasionally reliant on a nice glass of wine to relieve the stress of what is a constant ufc fight in my house.   So on Friday evening I popped in to your Bletchley store to pick up a bottle of my favourite wine (after long day and facing kids and wife in battle at home much needed). Picked up a few impulse bits and headed to the wine aisle. Being a regular I can pretty much traverse the aisle and pick up my wine with the same fluidity of an Olympic relay handover. As I reached the wines usual location stooped down. In readiness  reached to collect  to my horror the shelf was empty.   While normally this would not be an issue  as it s a nice wine and may just be sold out   on closer inspection it appears no!! MY brand is now discontinued 😯  it gets worse in selling off the stock the price was reduced to £2.75 a bottle 😲 (at no point was I informed of this) I am also at a loss as to who bought the remaining stock as before it was reduced I seemed to be only one purchasing and the shelves were normally full.   The story does not end there  I then in shock and reeling from this discovery realise I have to pick a new brand  I start looking (for reference my previous favourite was vineyards hill Merlot from Chile price £4 a bottle) I discover a new merlot  but wait there is a very similar name this time mountain vineyards (hmmm seems lot like my old fav) then I have a thought maybe I am saved and it s just a rebrand  hold on let me check price  £4.75.   I have to say the cynical side of me starts to think my good friends at Tesco could be tricking me into paying more for what is essentially the same product.  Using some basic mathematics I looked at my average purchasing and the new price and realised over a year this devious ploy will cost me around £100 a year more 😥.   You can obviously understand my disappointment and I am sure can sympathise with my plight now of having to try an parent without my favourite wine.
I just completed a survey for you and have found out that I am being charge £4.50 per month.  Please stop this transaction.  I feel that using your survey has resulted in me beng scammed.

I went to your Tesco express branch 780-790 Bath Rd Cranford  Hounslow. The cashier (since she refused to give me her name; I can only describe her appearance and my time of visit; she was approx 6 feet tall african lady with a red tesco shirt with no name badge and blue tesco trousers; I went to the store approx 7am 03/06/2016) I told her that i was looking to get a 10 pack of menthol cigarettes and asked if she could slide the shutter covering the cigarettes so i can pick one of the packs. She said in an abrupt tone   which ones do you want  we have many different ones.  I reiterated that if she slides the shutter open then I can have a look. She slides the shutter and let go saying   well if I slide it open it will just slide back shut again . I told her she could have kept the shutter open for a few seconds by holding it and told her which pack i wanted (i had managed to catch a glimpse of one of the brands). I took a trip to your Wath Upon Dearne store today with my three children to pick up a few bits. I wasn t feeling particularly well. Disgusted by the attitude of the security guard at Stalybridge store today. We had just got a tiny 8 week old puppy for my disabled sister and needed to pick some things up for him so thought we d pop into my local Tesco for them.  Upon entering  I was holding the puppy in my arms and my sister next to me  the security guard gave me the filthiest look and insisted for health and hygiene reasons the puppy needed to wait outside  under normal circumstances I would ve accepted this however I explained my sister is disabled and epileptic (she has had several fits in this store previously) and can not be left alone so if the puppy waited outside that would mean either she s wondering tesco alone or she s stood outside alone. This is not acceptable she can not be alone. He proceeded to tell me it s  tough  and she would need to stay outside. I didn t continue to argue we just left the store and went to Asda instead who were more than helpful and understanding towards my situation. His attitude was a disgrace and he s let the store down big time today! That will be the last time I enter a Tesco store because clearly they do not have any understanding or compassion to the disabled.
