Dear Tescos  I popped into my local store this morning (Tesco Royston Extra - Hertfordshire) to buy some skinless and boneless salmon portions from your fresh fish counter - I do this most weeks.  I was very frustrated to find that this method of presentation has now been discontinued on your fresh fish counter and I was directed to pre-packaged salmon sides or portions. I am astounded that you have chosen to do this as salmon is very popular.  I have now been to another supermarket and purchased it there as I do not want pre-packaged  older and more expensive salmon. I have noticed recently you have discontinued/no longer stock a number of items I used to regularly buy..... To the point I can no longer do my entire weeks shop with Tescos  I have to do half elsewhere (Morrisons/Sainsburys/Lidl)  Another question.... Why are all your carrots currently from Israel?  They are the most watery and tasteless carrots I have ever had.... Even the rabbits won t touch them. I also wonder why you chose to source them from Israel when you actively promote and educate  Farm to Fork  to the local children in store.  I have seen these sessions and to the best of my knowledge at no point is importation on a jet or shipping container mentioned..... Just explanation about local farmers harvesting.  While I can appreciate some produce cannot be sourced from the UK  carrots are not one of them.  Please either buy British or stop mis-educating our children as to where their food is coming from.  Yours sincerely  Frustrated Tescos customer.

Hi there Tesco  I just wanted to say a huge thank you and would appreciate you forwarding on my thanks to your Uttoxeter store. Unfortunately I had been in hospital all bank holiday weekend and discharged late Sunday evening. By Tuesday I  felt  up to getting a few bits in  as I was starting to go a little stir crazy. Any way  off I pop to your Uttoxeter store to gather by necessities. All went well  went to a self check out area  paid and left. Perfect! Or so I thought?! It turns out  I hadn t been my usual  with it  self. It came to yesterday lunch time  came to pay for something else and realised...well panicked...I had lost my debit card. First call was to the BF  no he didn t have it in his car. Second call to Tesco s customer service  explained my predicament and the lovely gentleman went away for a moment to check. Great news they had my card. Fantastic! All I needed to do was pop in with some photo ID and collect. Now all of this I would imagine is quite ordinary  but I wanted to say thank you and congratulate your staff on their fantastic customer service. From start to finish  they were polite  helpful and all round very understanding. The gentleman on the phone  the lady that greeted me at the store with a smile. It made the whole experience  that could of quite easily be a negative one  an un stressful smooth process from start to finish. And please please please  pass on my thanks to your staff at the store.

mate  ive just spent a good 10 minutes recovering from a devastating event  trying to fathom that out of all the universes  why this happened in this one  and happened to me in particular. whats the story  you might ask?   Well  it all started when i was feeling rather peckish (long day in work  the usual deal) so i decided it was time for my daily trip to tesco to pick up a sandwich or a light snack to have on my way home. all was going well  the only difference being  this time i found myself in merthyr  so i went to the tesco there instead of the one in aberdare. after browsing through the selection (and there was a fair bit considering it was late into the evening  so good job on that) i decided to go for the chicken  tomato and basil pasta (a favorite of mine  that i only get sometimes because they dont stock it in aberdare  very strange)  anyway i make my purchase  and proceed home  thinking of the delightful taste of the pasta that will soon be in my mouth. but when i got home  disaster struck. i sat down  ready to enjoy the pasta in all its glory  and peel back the label covering for the plastic fork  only to find that the fork is absent!  i was now faced with a life changing decision  to leave the pasta  unopened  or to go and get a fork and add to dishes that i dont want to do  wasting valuable time and effort after a long day of mind crushing  soul eating work.  as im sure you can appreciate  this was a hard decision for me to make  and one that no decent human being would take lightly.   i am not writing for any sort of compensation or refund  i just ask that you ensure that this horrible occurrence is prevented  so that no other poor soul has to endure the pain and struggle that was set before me today.   thank you for your time in reading this.  kind regards  your pal  your buddy  your chum  your pasta loving mate  Ross.  p.s. i ll probably just get a fork.

Dear tesco  This is a complaint to tesco direct. Order number Y9CHBPBG I ordered a silent night memory foam mattress last Friday night.  I paid for it using clubcard vouchers I have saved up for a long time.  The order said it would be delivered on Wednesday 1st June and an adult would have to sign for it.  My husband took the day off work yesterday to be here when it arrived.  He rang to ask where it was at about 12.45  he was told it was with yodel.  He rang again at 4.45 and was told someone would chase silent night and get back to him.  I rang approx 6 and was told it probably wouldn t be with us on June 1st but they would try and make sure it was delivered today.  I complained that the email told us it would be June 1st and my husband had taken a days holiday and that tesco should not offer this service if silent night cannot deliver.  Today at 11.30 I received an email to advise me my mattress would arrive tomorrow 3rd June.  During the afternoon I took the dog out and there was no one home  and I received a text from my neighbour to say the mattress had been delivered to them at approx 2.30. I arrived home  got the mattress only to find it was the wrong size  we had ordered king size and we now have a double mattress in our hall.  My husband called tesco at approx 6pm to be told silent night had gone home and he would be advised tomorrow afternoon on what would happen next.  I am very  very annoyed in 3 main areas 1. It did not arrive yesterday despite our order confirmation email telling us it would 2. It arrived today when no one was home despite an email advising us it would be here tomorrow 3. We do not have the product we ordered  Please advise by return how this situation will be resolved and what compensation you are going to give us for the inconvenience caused when all we wanted to do was buy a mattress and not have all this hassle. Thank you Amy shepherd

Got this email from Tesco today. This sucks big time! Doesn t seem like an improvement to me. Topcashback was what helped me grow my points balance faster.   As a Tesco Clubcard customer who has earned points with TopCashback before  we wanted to let you know that the 31st July will be the last date that you will be able to exchange your TopCashback payouts for Clubcard points.    Our relationship with TopCashback is coming to an end as part of the improvements we are making changes to the Tesco Clubcard scheme to make it simpler to understand and easier to use. We have heard from our customers that they want to grow their points balance faster  and get more value back from their usual shop  so we will be focusing on creating more ways customers can earn points at Tesco. Keep a look out for special opportunities to earn bonus points in store and online.    There will be more news to follow  but if you have any questions please visit tesco.com/clubcard.    Thank you for being a member of Tesco Clubcard.  Your Tesco Clubcard Team

The Tesco advert for returning any food or product you change your mind about for a refund or replacement... not liking this if it results in a big increase in wasted food. The advert shows a fresh product being returned because the buyer didn t fancy it  so what will they do with all returned food? bin it? surely they can t re sell unsealed products. I never usually get my knickers in a knot about adverts but there is far too much food wasted already.

Regarding Tesco in Northern Ireland  I want to complain strongly at the removal of  many of the Northern Ireland related Euro 2016 football merchandise products.  This is an opportunity for the whole country to support the national team  to get together and enjoy a long overdue national spectacle. It is 30 years since this opporunity last occured  30 years in which the country is supposed to have reached a peace between the communities  30 years in which attitudes are supposed to have changed and 30 years in which we all should be able to celebrate our national football team s success.  I m therefore very disappointed and frustrated that a very small minority of haters and agitators have forced a large national company to remove items which could help all the people support the team in France. Many of these few protagonists chose to deliberately be offended in order to ferment a bigger row than it ever needs to be. By pandering to these few  instead of backing the many  you weaken your commercial position. I for one  will no longer shop at Tesco until this is resolved satisfactorily to the majority of decent citizens trying to support a fully inclusive national football team.

Hi  I thought I d share with you the HORRENDOUS customer service I experienced yesterday whilst in your  super  store in Chesterfield. Not only are the staff very very unhelpful  they really have no pride in what they do and they definitely don t care about your customers. MOST WASTEFUL COMPANY IN THE UK BY FAR!! Well I ve phoned your customer service team  but this was before I realised how outrageous the packaging on my order really were. 7 huge boxes to package 3x22l boxes (all separately with masses of paper padding  but some common sense was used and the bin was put in one of the crates)  1 laundry basket covered in bubble wrap  3 shoe boxes (all together finally) and 2xhopscotch number playmats (both in separate boxes and with excessive paper once again). And there was even a flat box WITHIN a box! I now have to find a way of storing all of this until the recycling is collected next week in my flat (thank goodness I am not limited with the amount of recycling I can put out). And I also need to find a way to bag it all up so it s actually taken by the refuse collectors.  This is the most wasteful  environmentally damaging and unfriendly practice I have ever come across. I will post the photos I managed to get as my toddler wasn t enjoying the lack of space and the inevitable mess is unbearable.   I have a feeling that you made a huge loss on my order. The cost of postage  packaging and staff costs would ve barely been covered by the almost £30 I spent. This has put me off ordering from you ever again and I will actively tell friends and family to avoid such unethical practices.

Hi Tesco I am concerned and worried about your new advert.......... bring your item back if you change your mind and get it swapped. Are you for real? I was recently informed by one of your checkout staff that this Clubcard Boost was the last one. We ve not had any mailing about this. We save our points for Christmas vouchers  but I wanted to see if the points we had could be changed to vouchers now so we could use them in the boost.  Browsing on Tesco Direct I found a 10ft Plum trampoline for £89.98 included in the boost  so on Monday 30 May I rang in the morning. It was confirmed that I would be be able to have points transferred to vouchers. But they d need to speak to my husband as the card is in his name. Called again about 7pm and  with his consent  I was told the points would be issued as a money card email that I would receive in 24 hours.  It s now Wednesday 1 June  over 48 hours later  and I ve not had any email from Tesco. And now...The trampoline we wanted has reverted to £130. I ve just checked my points balance and its not changed. Indicating to me that no action has taken place to change out points to vouchers.  So my question is: As we were not informed of the final boost and because we did not receive the email in the specified time frame in order for us to use our vouchers to boost...Are you able to honour the price of the trampoline at £89.98 and let us use our vouchers in the boost on it?  Because at the moment I have promised our two little girls a trampoline  and I don t want to break their hearts because I cannot afford the price hike.  Thank you.
I m trying to book a slot online but it s not working is there anything I can do so I can get my shopping delivered?

May I grumble about fair pricing? I m a set-in-my-ways shopper who regularly buys similar products and accepts the price they are in your store. I get irrationally angry when my regular products are unavailable because they re sold out when a special deal makes them a fraction of the regular price. Not only do I miss out on the deal  I miss my regular purchase. I m not naïve enough to believe you lose out through the price cuts  so suspect the supplier takes a hit in the interest of the promotion but as I (and I assume I m not alone in this) intend being on the planet another half century or so  buying similar products if I like them  living in the same house  shopping in the same shops (if you still exist)  can t you simply agree a fair price to your supplier  price reasonably to give your shareholders a fair profit while not forcing your customers away  but stop silly discounting and offers so the dull  every week visitor can rely on being able to make the purchases they enjoy? Butter has brought this request about. I am unable to enjoy my usual sandwiches because you ve none of my usual brand owing to a ridiculous price cut. Are dairy farmers suddenly so wealthy they can cut their prices? Is butter so ridiculously overpriced you can slash the price so? I ll wager not. I ll be buying it whether on special offer or not but can t when it s not even on the shelf. Unfortunately for you today  I didn t purchase an alternative since I simply traveled the 2 miles to one of your competitors where it wasn t on offer but was available. So how about fair pricing for a fair product for fairly looked-after suppliers?  I know this won t affect too many share dividend payments but  I m sure you ll agree  every little helps.

I am sorry to have to complain on facebook but theres no email address for complaints and the web form doesnt allow enough characters to write the numerous issues with my recent tesco direct order.  I placed an order for a tablet and some accessories on friday night. I was quite surprised that despite offering  next day click and collect  my order would not be ready until the following wednesday - I do appreciate that it was after the 5pm cut off and a bank holiday but it wasn t even ready next working day (tuesday) and many big online retailers are still able to deliver next day click and collect on sundays and bank holidays so I was quite surprised tesco couldn t facilitate this.  Despite this I went with tesco because I believed I could rely on them to deliver my order on time.  Unfortunatly this was not the case. I received three different dispatch emails last night all stating my order would be ready to collect today. I received notification that  out of the 3 parcels had arrived but not the 3rd. I went online to track my order to find that the system coudlnt even tell me that yodel had received the parcell (Despite it being  dispatched ) and had no eta for the parcel. Confused I went into store - the staff were very helpful and rang up to chase the parcel but the response was less than satisfactory. I was told that they had to give yodel 48 hours to deliver the parcel - if this is the case why did the dispatch email sent 10pm last night still say it would arrive today?  I was also told that the reason it was dispatched by yodel is because it was coming from a different supplier. I found this particularly aggravating as I picked the tablet based on it being dispatched from tesco as I wanted to avoid the hassle that comes with buying from a third party seller - there was a much better tablet for the same price from a third party!  So here I am 5 days after placing my order with accessories and no tablet - I need to have it by tomorrow! I am awaiting a call from the store in the morning in the vague hope that it appears in the order but I don t have much faith if I am honest!
Any chance of thech team answering the phone? Having been on hold for almost 20 mins I was cut off- not impressed!
Tesco  have you stopped selling Colliers Welsh cheese as our Extra seems to have stopped it and will you be getting in any more of  Dave s Insanity Sauce  please?

Hi  I used your home delivery service last weeks for the second time. The first time I was super impressed btw!  Anyway I had cause to change my delivery the  morning it was due as I had to go out that afternoon last minute  i phoned your customer services line that morning and asked if it was possible to change it to click and collect so I could pick it up instead  which I was told I could and given the time of 2pm. When I got to the click and collect at the time the customer services lady had given me I was met by a lovely customer assistant called Jo nokes  unfortunately there had been some mis communication somewhere along the line and she was unable to locate my shopping at the click and collect.  Anyway she was absolutely lovely and phoned through the the main store to try and establish what had happened (I took full responsibility as I had changed it last minute anyway) not even 10 minutes later Jo came back to me and said that if I was to go to customer services in the main store then my shopping would be there ready for me to collect :-) I was already very pleased with the service I had received... But it got better When I got to customer services the lady by the desk (I m sorry I don t know her name) called through to someone and a few minutes later the manager Ben (Maga/magor?) I can t read my own writing lol came out and seeing I was heavily pregnant not only took the shopping to my car  he also helped me bag it up and unpack it from the boxes into my boot! I think that both went over and beyond what they needed to do to help me especially as it was me changing the order last minute that had caused the confusion   they could have easily sent me away to await delivery like I had originally asked for. It is important to me that they are recognised for their good work as it is very rare that people s good work is acknowledged.  Thank you very much! It was very appreciated
Dissapointed at tesco not stocking the Asprin 75mg anymore  trying to do my bit at helping the nhs and not getting it on script  buying it was far cheaper........

I m not usually one to rant on Facebook but I m so disgusted with Tesco A few days ago Andrew and Tamara did their usual online shop and chose a delivery slot for between 4 and 5 yesterday. Said shopping didn t arrive  so a very hungry Andrew rang customer services to find out where it was .......  Apparently there had been some kind of mistake  which is fine  mistakes happen  so delivery was rearranged for today and he was offered a £6.00 discount  which is also fine.  What has made me REALLY mad is the fact that last night he rang me asking to borrow £150.00 - he s just been paid - apparently not only has he paid for his shopping but he has also somehow ended up paying for it AGAIN!  Andrew and Tamara are 21 and 20 respectively  Tam is a student and has no income  so they manage on Andrew s income. This has totally messed them up  they still have rent and living expenses to pay and they have no money left until Tesco repay their money.  Customer services have told them it will take 3 to 5 five working days for them to receive their repayment  they have been of little or no help  basically just fobbing them off with excuses and promised phone calls that don t happen and all they have offered in a measly £10 total discount - the poor kids spent more than that in the Co-Op last night getting cat food and something for dinner.

If your a parent you know how hard shopping can be with 3 little uns running you crazy while ur trying to remember what shopping you need for the week. By the time u get to the till your frazzled  you just want to go home and the kids just wont stop fighting and running laps up and down the tills. Then the nicest thing happens.... the cashier sees your struggling  sees your son is tired and bored and decides to distract your rioting 5 year old by getting him to  help  with the shopping. I don t know if this girl is on facebook but she amazed me with her kindness today and gave me 5 quiet mins while she calmed my son to pack my shopping but most importantly she made my son smile. THANK YOU TESCO CASHIER! <3

Dear Tesco  I am contacting you regards the imperfect strawberries you have recently been selling for 75p. I thought this was a great idea as not only as a family do we get through a lot of fruit and vegetables it was encouraging those on a budget to buy and eat more healthily.   My high school son  age 14  also chooses to buy his lunch from yourselves too. He has a budget and loved it that he could afford for part of his lunch a punnet of the imperfect fruit along with a pasta bowl. He prefers this to buying a meal deal including fruit as the packet there is smaller and he is a hungry growing boy  and on a budget.   After speaking to a member of the greencrocer staff i was not sure if anymore imperfect fruit would be coming in; and although fruit is sometimes discounted it is not until 2pm across the company as a whole. I feel maybe to help promote healthy eating particularly to those on a low budget and to those children/consumer wishing to choose a healthy filling option maybe more imperfect fruit and vegetables and the timings of reduced fruit and vegetables could be reviewed inline with lunchtimes? This would allow a healthier choice to be considered  purchased and consumed  particularly in our future generation.  Look forward to your feedback.  Kind regards

Hi Tesco. In my area  the Tesco Hardengreen store has been a great support to local food banks. The recent story about your Leith store needing to attach security devices to in continence pants made me wonder: would these be items stolen by career criminals or is it perhaps that some of the poorest in society are just desperately seeking some dignity? I of course can not claim to know the answer for sure  but wonder if it might be possible for you (or Tena) to use some of your corporate social responsibility budget to donate some of these pants to local health clinics  food banks or other relevant community groups? Or even to encourage customers to donate such items for food banks (I for one would be happy to donate to such a drive)? I know there have been similar collections of nappies etc. I may be wrong and only your experts will see the difference  but it may significantly reduce the need to buy the expensive security tags to protect future stocks? There will be someone better qualified than I to advise  but just thought I would put the suggestion out there.
